00027 #include "socklnd.h"
00028 
00029 ksock_tx_t *
00030 ksocknal_alloc_tx(int type, int size)
00031 {
00032         ksock_tx_t *tx = NULL;
00033 
00034         if (type == KSOCK_MSG_NOOP) {
00035                 LASSERT(size == KSOCK_NOOP_TX_SIZE);
00036 
00037                 /* searching for a noop tx in free list */
00038                 spin_lock(&ksocknal_data.ksnd_tx_lock);
00039 
00040                 if (!list_empty(&ksocknal_data.ksnd_idle_noop_txs)) {
00041                         tx = list_entry(ksocknal_data.ksnd_idle_noop_txs. \
00042                                             next, ksock_tx_t, tx_list);
00043                         LASSERT(tx->tx_desc_size == size);
00044                         list_del(&tx->tx_list);
00045                 }
00046 
00047                 spin_unlock(&ksocknal_data.ksnd_tx_lock);
00048         }
00049 
00050         if (tx == NULL)
00051                 LIBCFS_ALLOC(tx, size);
00052 
00053         if (tx == NULL)
00054                 return NULL;
00055 
00056         atomic_set(&tx->tx_refcount, 1);
00057         tx->tx_zc_aborted = 0;
00058         tx->tx_zc_capable = 0;
00059         tx->tx_zc_checked = 0;
00060         tx->tx_desc_size  = size;
00061 
00062         atomic_inc(&ksocknal_data.ksnd_nactive_txs);
00063 
00064         return tx;
00065 }
00066 
00067 ksock_tx_t *
00068 ksocknal_alloc_tx_noop(__u64 cookie, int nonblk)
00069 {
00070         ksock_tx_t *tx;
00071 
00072         tx = ksocknal_alloc_tx(KSOCK_MSG_NOOP, KSOCK_NOOP_TX_SIZE);
00073         if (tx == NULL) {
00074                 CERROR("Can't allocate noop tx desc\n");
00075                 return NULL;
00076         }
00077 
00078         tx->tx_conn     = NULL;
00079         tx->tx_lnetmsg  = NULL;
00080         tx->tx_kiov     = NULL;
00081         tx->tx_nkiov    = 0;
00082         tx->tx_iov      = tx->tx_frags.virt.iov;
00083         tx->tx_niov     = 1;
00084         tx->tx_nonblk   = nonblk;
00085 
00086         socklnd_init_msg(&tx->tx_msg, KSOCK_MSG_NOOP);
00087         tx->tx_msg.ksm_zc_cookies[1] = cookie;
00088 
00089         return tx;
00090 }
00091 
00092 
00093 void
00094 ksocknal_free_tx (ksock_tx_t *tx)
00095 {
00096         atomic_dec(&ksocknal_data.ksnd_nactive_txs);
00097 
00098         if (tx->tx_lnetmsg == NULL && tx->tx_desc_size == KSOCK_NOOP_TX_SIZE) {
00099                 /* it's a noop tx */
00100                 spin_lock(&ksocknal_data.ksnd_tx_lock);
00101 
00102                 list_add(&tx->tx_list, &ksocknal_data.ksnd_idle_noop_txs);
00103 
00104                 spin_unlock(&ksocknal_data.ksnd_tx_lock);
00105         } else {
00106                 LIBCFS_FREE(tx, tx->tx_desc_size);
00107         }
00108 }
00109 
00110 static int
00111 ksocknal_send_iov (ksock_conn_t *conn, ksock_tx_t *tx)
00112 {
00113         struct kvec *iov = tx->tx_iov;
00114         int    nob;
00115         int    rc;
00116 
00117         LASSERT (tx->tx_niov > 0);
00118 
00119         /* Never touch tx->tx_iov inside ksocknal_lib_send_iov() */
00120         rc = ksocknal_lib_send_iov(conn, tx);
00121 
00122         if (rc <= 0)                            /* sent nothing? */
00123                 return (rc);
00124 
00125         nob = rc;
00126         LASSERT (nob <= tx->tx_resid);
00127         tx->tx_resid -= nob;
00128 
00129         /* "consume" iov */
00130         do {
00131                 LASSERT (tx->tx_niov > 0);
00132 
00133                 if (nob < (int) iov->iov_len) {
00134                         iov->iov_base += nob;
00135                         iov->iov_len -= nob;
00136                         return (rc);
00137                 }
00138 
00139                 nob -= iov->iov_len;
00140                 tx->tx_iov = ++iov;
00141                 tx->tx_niov--;
00142         } while (nob != 0);
00143 
00144         return (rc);
00145 }
00146 
00147 static int
00148 ksocknal_send_kiov (ksock_conn_t *conn, ksock_tx_t *tx)
00149 {
00150         lnet_kiov_t    *kiov = tx->tx_kiov;
00151         int     nob;
00152         int     rc;
00153 
00154         LASSERT (tx->tx_niov == 0);
00155         LASSERT (tx->tx_nkiov > 0);
00156 
00157         /* Never touch tx->tx_kiov inside ksocknal_lib_send_kiov() */
00158         rc = ksocknal_lib_send_kiov(conn, tx);
00159 
00160         if (rc <= 0)                            /* sent nothing? */
00161                 return (rc);
00162 
00163         nob = rc;
00164         LASSERT (nob <= tx->tx_resid);
00165         tx->tx_resid -= nob;
00166 
00167         /* "consume" kiov */
00168         do {
00169                 LASSERT(tx->tx_nkiov > 0);
00170 
00171                 if (nob < (int)kiov->kiov_len) {
00172                         kiov->kiov_offset += nob;
00173                         kiov->kiov_len -= nob;
00174                         return rc;
00175                 }
00176 
00177                 nob -= (int)kiov->kiov_len;
00178                 tx->tx_kiov = ++kiov;
00179                 tx->tx_nkiov--;
00180         } while (nob != 0);
00181 
00182         return (rc);
00183 }
00184 
00185 static int
00186 ksocknal_transmit(ksock_conn_t *conn, ksock_tx_t *tx)
00187 {
00188         int     rc;
00189         int     bufnob;
00190 
00191         if (ksocknal_data.ksnd_stall_tx != 0) {
00192                 set_current_state(TASK_UNINTERRUPTIBLE);
00193                 schedule_timeout(cfs_time_seconds(ksocknal_data.ksnd_stall_tx));
00194         }
00195 
00196         LASSERT(tx->tx_resid != 0);
00197 
00198         rc = ksocknal_connsock_addref(conn);
00199         if (rc != 0) {
00200                 LASSERT (conn->ksnc_closing);
00201                 return (-ESHUTDOWN);
00202         }
00203 
00204         do {
00205                 if (ksocknal_data.ksnd_enomem_tx > 0) {
00206                         /* testing... */
00207                         ksocknal_data.ksnd_enomem_tx--;
00208                         rc = -EAGAIN;
00209                 } else if (tx->tx_niov != 0) {
00210                         rc = ksocknal_send_iov (conn, tx);
00211                 } else {
00212                         rc = ksocknal_send_kiov (conn, tx);
00213                 }
00214 
00215                 bufnob = conn->ksnc_sock->sk->sk_wmem_queued;
00216                 if (rc > 0)                     /* sent something? */
00217                         conn->ksnc_tx_bufnob += rc; /* account it */
00218 
00219                 if (bufnob < conn->ksnc_tx_bufnob) {
00220                         /* allocated send buffer bytes < computed; infer
00221                          * something got ACKed */
00222                         conn->ksnc_tx_deadline =
00223                                 cfs_time_shift(*ksocknal_tunables.ksnd_timeout);
00224                         conn->ksnc_peer->ksnp_last_alive = cfs_time_current();
00225                         conn->ksnc_tx_bufnob = bufnob;
00226                         smp_mb();
00227                 }
00228 
00229                 if (rc <= 0) { /* Didn't write anything? */
00230 
00231                         if (rc == 0) /* some stacks return 0 instead of -EAGAIN */
00232                                 rc = -EAGAIN;
00233 
00234                         /* Check if EAGAIN is due to memory pressure */
00235                         if(rc == -EAGAIN && ksocknal_lib_memory_pressure(conn))
00236                                 rc = -ENOMEM;
00237 
00238                         break;
00239                 }
00240 
00241                 /* socket's wmem_queued now includes 'rc' bytes */
00242                 atomic_sub (rc, &conn->ksnc_tx_nob);
00243                 rc = 0;
00244 
00245         } while (tx->tx_resid != 0);
00246 
00247         ksocknal_connsock_decref(conn);
00248         return (rc);
00249 }
00250 
00251 static int
00252 ksocknal_recv_iov (ksock_conn_t *conn)
00253 {
00254         struct kvec *iov = conn->ksnc_rx_iov;
00255         int     nob;
00256         int     rc;
00257 
00258         LASSERT (conn->ksnc_rx_niov > 0);
00259 
00260         /* Never touch conn->ksnc_rx_iov or change connection
00261          * status inside ksocknal_lib_recv_iov */
00262         rc = ksocknal_lib_recv_iov(conn);
00263 
00264         if (rc <= 0)
00265                 return (rc);
00266 
00267         /* received something... */
00268         nob = rc;
00269 
00270         conn->ksnc_peer->ksnp_last_alive = cfs_time_current();
00271         conn->ksnc_rx_deadline =
00272                 cfs_time_shift(*ksocknal_tunables.ksnd_timeout);
00273         smp_mb();                       /* order with setting rx_started */
00274         conn->ksnc_rx_started = 1;
00275 
00276         conn->ksnc_rx_nob_wanted -= nob;
00277         conn->ksnc_rx_nob_left -= nob;
00278 
00279         do {
00280                 LASSERT (conn->ksnc_rx_niov > 0);
00281 
00282                 if (nob < (int)iov->iov_len) {
00283                         iov->iov_len -= nob;
00284                         iov->iov_base += nob;
00285                         return (-EAGAIN);
00286                 }
00287 
00288                 nob -= iov->iov_len;
00289                 conn->ksnc_rx_iov = ++iov;
00290                 conn->ksnc_rx_niov--;
00291         } while (nob != 0);
00292 
00293         return (rc);
00294 }
00295 
00296 static int
00297 ksocknal_recv_kiov (ksock_conn_t *conn)
00298 {
00299         lnet_kiov_t   *kiov = conn->ksnc_rx_kiov;
00300         int     nob;
00301         int     rc;
00302         LASSERT (conn->ksnc_rx_nkiov > 0);
00303 
00304         /* Never touch conn->ksnc_rx_kiov or change connection
00305          * status inside ksocknal_lib_recv_iov */
00306         rc = ksocknal_lib_recv_kiov(conn);
00307 
00308         if (rc <= 0)
00309                 return (rc);
00310 
00311         /* received something... */
00312         nob = rc;
00313 
00314         conn->ksnc_peer->ksnp_last_alive = cfs_time_current();
00315         conn->ksnc_rx_deadline =
00316                 cfs_time_shift(*ksocknal_tunables.ksnd_timeout);
00317         smp_mb();                       /* order with setting rx_started */
00318         conn->ksnc_rx_started = 1;
00319 
00320         conn->ksnc_rx_nob_wanted -= nob;
00321         conn->ksnc_rx_nob_left -= nob;
00322 
00323         do {
00324                 LASSERT (conn->ksnc_rx_nkiov > 0);
00325 
00326                 if (nob < (int) kiov->kiov_len) {
00327                         kiov->kiov_offset += nob;
00328                         kiov->kiov_len -= nob;
00329                         return -EAGAIN;
00330                 }
00331 
00332                 nob -= kiov->kiov_len;
00333                 conn->ksnc_rx_kiov = ++kiov;
00334                 conn->ksnc_rx_nkiov--;
00335         } while (nob != 0);
00336 
00337         return 1;
00338 }
00339 
00340 static int
00341 ksocknal_receive (ksock_conn_t *conn)
00342 {
00343         /* Return 1 on success, 0 on EOF, < 0 on error.
00344          * Caller checks ksnc_rx_nob_wanted to determine
00345          * progress/completion. */
00346         int     rc;
00347         ENTRY;
00348 
00349         if (ksocknal_data.ksnd_stall_rx != 0) {
00350                 set_current_state(TASK_UNINTERRUPTIBLE);
00351                 schedule_timeout(cfs_time_seconds(ksocknal_data.ksnd_stall_rx));
00352         }
00353 
00354         rc = ksocknal_connsock_addref(conn);
00355         if (rc != 0) {
00356                 LASSERT (conn->ksnc_closing);
00357                 return (-ESHUTDOWN);
00358         }
00359 
00360         for (;;) {
00361                 if (conn->ksnc_rx_niov != 0)
00362                         rc = ksocknal_recv_iov (conn);
00363                 else
00364                         rc = ksocknal_recv_kiov (conn);
00365 
00366                 if (rc <= 0) {
00367                         /* error/EOF or partial receive */
00368                         if (rc == -EAGAIN) {
00369                                 rc = 1;
00370                         } else if (rc == 0 && conn->ksnc_rx_started) {
00371                                 /* EOF in the middle of a message */
00372                                 rc = -EPROTO;
00373                         }
00374                         break;
00375                 }
00376 
00377                 /* Completed a fragment */
00378 
00379                 if (conn->ksnc_rx_nob_wanted == 0) {
00380                         rc = 1;
00381                         break;
00382                 }
00383         }
00384 
00385         ksocknal_connsock_decref(conn);
00386         RETURN (rc);
00387 }
00388 
00389 void
00390 ksocknal_tx_done (lnet_ni_t *ni, ksock_tx_t *tx)
00391 {
00392         lnet_msg_t  *lnetmsg = tx->tx_lnetmsg;
00393         int          rc = (tx->tx_resid == 0 && !tx->tx_zc_aborted) ? 0 : -EIO;
00394         ENTRY;
00395 
00396         LASSERT(ni != NULL || tx->tx_conn != NULL);
00397 
00398         if (tx->tx_conn != NULL)
00399                 ksocknal_conn_decref(tx->tx_conn);
00400 
00401         if (ni == NULL && tx->tx_conn != NULL)
00402                 ni = tx->tx_conn->ksnc_peer->ksnp_ni;
00403 
00404         ksocknal_free_tx (tx);
00405         if (lnetmsg != NULL) /* KSOCK_MSG_NOOP go without lnetmsg */
00406                 lnet_finalize (ni, lnetmsg, rc);
00407 
00408         EXIT;
00409 }
00410 
00411 void
00412 ksocknal_txlist_done(lnet_ni_t *ni, struct list_head *txlist, int error)
00413 {
00414         ksock_tx_t *tx;
00415 
00416         while (!list_empty(txlist)) {
00417                 tx = list_entry(txlist->next, ksock_tx_t, tx_list);
00418 
00419                 if (error && tx->tx_lnetmsg != NULL) {
00420                         CNETERR("Deleting packet type %d len %d %s->%s\n",
00421                                 le32_to_cpu (tx->tx_lnetmsg->msg_hdr.type),
00422                                 le32_to_cpu (tx->tx_lnetmsg->msg_hdr.payload_length),
00423                                 libcfs_nid2str(le64_to_cpu(tx->tx_lnetmsg->msg_hdr.src_nid)),
00424                                 libcfs_nid2str(le64_to_cpu(tx->tx_lnetmsg->msg_hdr.dest_nid)));
00425                 } else if (error) {
00426                         CNETERR("Deleting noop packet\n");
00427                 }
00428 
00429                 list_del(&tx->tx_list);
00430 
00431                 LASSERT (atomic_read(&tx->tx_refcount) == 1);
00432                 ksocknal_tx_done (ni, tx);
00433         }
00434 }
00435 
00436 static void
00437 ksocknal_check_zc_req(ksock_tx_t *tx)
00438 {
00439         ksock_conn_t   *conn = tx->tx_conn;
00440         ksock_peer_t   *peer = conn->ksnc_peer;
00441 
00442         /* Set tx_msg.ksm_zc_cookies[0] to a unique non-zero cookie and add tx
00443          * to ksnp_zc_req_list if some fragment of this message should be sent
00444          * zero-copy.  Our peer will send an ACK containing this cookie when
00445          * she has received this message to tell us we can signal completion.
00446          * tx_msg.ksm_zc_cookies[0] remains non-zero while tx is on
00447          * ksnp_zc_req_list. */
00448         LASSERT (tx->tx_msg.ksm_type != KSOCK_MSG_NOOP);
00449         LASSERT (tx->tx_zc_capable);
00450 
00451         tx->tx_zc_checked = 1;
00452 
00453         if (conn->ksnc_proto == &ksocknal_protocol_v1x ||
00454             !conn->ksnc_zc_capable)
00455                 return;
00456 
00457         /* assign cookie and queue tx to pending list, it will be released when
00458          * a matching ack is received. See ksocknal_handle_zcack() */
00459 
00460         ksocknal_tx_addref(tx);
00461 
00462         spin_lock(&peer->ksnp_lock);
00463 
00464         /* ZC_REQ is going to be pinned to the peer */
00465         tx->tx_deadline =
00466                 cfs_time_shift(*ksocknal_tunables.ksnd_timeout);
00467 
00468         LASSERT (tx->tx_msg.ksm_zc_cookies[0] == 0);
00469 
00470         tx->tx_msg.ksm_zc_cookies[0] = peer->ksnp_zc_next_cookie++;
00471 
00472         if (peer->ksnp_zc_next_cookie == 0)
00473                 peer->ksnp_zc_next_cookie = SOCKNAL_KEEPALIVE_PING + 1;
00474 
00475         list_add_tail(&tx->tx_zc_list, &peer->ksnp_zc_req_list);
00476 
00477         spin_unlock(&peer->ksnp_lock);
00478 }
00479 
00480 static void
00481 ksocknal_uncheck_zc_req(ksock_tx_t *tx)
00482 {
00483         ksock_peer_t   *peer = tx->tx_conn->ksnc_peer;
00484 
00485         LASSERT(tx->tx_msg.ksm_type != KSOCK_MSG_NOOP);
00486         LASSERT(tx->tx_zc_capable);
00487 
00488         tx->tx_zc_checked = 0;
00489 
00490         spin_lock(&peer->ksnp_lock);
00491 
00492         if (tx->tx_msg.ksm_zc_cookies[0] == 0) {
00493                 /* Not waiting for an ACK */
00494                 spin_unlock(&peer->ksnp_lock);
00495                 return;
00496         }
00497 
00498         tx->tx_msg.ksm_zc_cookies[0] = 0;
00499         list_del(&tx->tx_zc_list);
00500 
00501         spin_unlock(&peer->ksnp_lock);
00502 
00503         ksocknal_tx_decref(tx);
00504 }
00505 
00506 static int
00507 ksocknal_process_transmit (ksock_conn_t *conn, ksock_tx_t *tx)
00508 {
00509         int            rc;
00510 
00511         if (tx->tx_zc_capable && !tx->tx_zc_checked)
00512                 ksocknal_check_zc_req(tx);
00513 
00514         rc = ksocknal_transmit (conn, tx);
00515 
00516         CDEBUG (D_NET, "send(%d) %d\n", tx->tx_resid, rc);
00517 
00518         if (tx->tx_resid == 0) {
00519                 /* Sent everything OK */
00520                 LASSERT (rc == 0);
00521 
00522                 return (0);
00523         }
00524 
00525         if (rc == -EAGAIN)
00526                 return (rc);
00527 
00528         if (rc == -ENOMEM) {
00529                 static int counter;
00530 
00531                 counter++;   /* exponential backoff warnings */
00532                 if ((counter & (-counter)) == counter)
00533                         CWARN("%u ENOMEM tx %p (%u allocated)\n",
00534                               counter, conn, atomic_read(&libcfs_kmemory));
00535 
00536                 /* Queue on ksnd_enomem_conns for retry after a timeout */
00537                 spin_lock_bh(&ksocknal_data.ksnd_reaper_lock);
00538 
00539                 /* enomem list takes over scheduler's ref... */
00540                 LASSERT (conn->ksnc_tx_scheduled);
00541                 list_add_tail(&conn->ksnc_tx_list,
00542                                   &ksocknal_data.ksnd_enomem_conns);
00543                 if (!cfs_time_aftereq(cfs_time_add(cfs_time_current(),
00544                                         SOCKNAL_ENOMEM_RETRY),
00545                                         ksocknal_data.ksnd_reaper_waketime))
00546                         wake_up(&ksocknal_data.ksnd_reaper_waitq);
00547 
00548                 spin_unlock_bh(&ksocknal_data.ksnd_reaper_lock);
00549                 return (rc);
00550         }
00551 
00552         /* Actual error */
00553         LASSERT (rc < 0);
00554 
00555         if (!conn->ksnc_closing) {
00556                 switch (rc) {
00557                 case -ECONNRESET:
00558                         LCONSOLE_WARN("Host %pI4h reset our connection "
00559                                       "while we were sending data; it may have "
00560                                       "rebooted.\n",
00561                                       &conn->ksnc_ipaddr);
00562                         break;
00563                 default:
00564                         LCONSOLE_WARN("There was an unexpected network error "
00565                                       "while writing to %pI4h: %d.\n",
00566                                       &conn->ksnc_ipaddr, rc);
00567                         break;
00568                 }
00569                 CDEBUG(D_NET, "[%p] Error %d on write to %s ip %pI4h:%d\n",
00570                        conn, rc, libcfs_id2str(conn->ksnc_peer->ksnp_id),
00571                        &conn->ksnc_ipaddr, conn->ksnc_port);
00572         }
00573 
00574         if (tx->tx_zc_checked)
00575                 ksocknal_uncheck_zc_req(tx);
00576 
00577         /* it's not an error if conn is being closed */
00578         ksocknal_close_conn_and_siblings (conn,
00579                                           (conn->ksnc_closing) ? 0 : rc);
00580 
00581         return (rc);
00582 }
00583 
00584 static void
00585 ksocknal_launch_connection_locked (ksock_route_t *route)
00586 {
00587 
00588         /* called holding write lock on ksnd_global_lock */
00589 
00590         LASSERT (!route->ksnr_scheduled);
00591         LASSERT (!route->ksnr_connecting);
00592         LASSERT ((ksocknal_route_mask() & ~route->ksnr_connected) != 0);
00593 
00594         route->ksnr_scheduled = 1;              /* scheduling conn for connd */
00595         ksocknal_route_addref(route);           /* extra ref for connd */
00596 
00597         spin_lock_bh(&ksocknal_data.ksnd_connd_lock);
00598 
00599         list_add_tail(&route->ksnr_connd_list,
00600                           &ksocknal_data.ksnd_connd_routes);
00601         wake_up(&ksocknal_data.ksnd_connd_waitq);
00602 
00603         spin_unlock_bh(&ksocknal_data.ksnd_connd_lock);
00604 }
00605 
00606 void
00607 ksocknal_launch_all_connections_locked (ksock_peer_t *peer)
00608 {
00609         ksock_route_t *route;
00610 
00611         /* called holding write lock on ksnd_global_lock */
00612         for (;;) {
00613                 /* launch any/all connections that need it */
00614                 route = ksocknal_find_connectable_route_locked(peer);
00615                 if (route == NULL)
00616                         return;
00617 
00618                 ksocknal_launch_connection_locked(route);
00619         }
00620 }
00621 
00622 ksock_conn_t *
00623 ksocknal_find_conn_locked(ksock_peer_t *peer, ksock_tx_t *tx, int nonblk)
00624 {
00625         struct list_head *tmp;
00626         ksock_conn_t     *conn;
00627         ksock_conn_t     *typed = NULL;
00628         ksock_conn_t     *fallback = NULL;
00629         int               tnob     = 0;
00630         int               fnob     = 0;
00631 
00632         list_for_each(tmp, &peer->ksnp_conns) {
00633                 ksock_conn_t *c  = list_entry(tmp, ksock_conn_t, ksnc_list);
00634                 int           nob = atomic_read(&c->ksnc_tx_nob) +
00635                                         c->ksnc_sock->sk->sk_wmem_queued;
00636                 int           rc;
00637 
00638                 LASSERT (!c->ksnc_closing);
00639                 LASSERT (c->ksnc_proto != NULL &&
00640                          c->ksnc_proto->pro_match_tx != NULL);
00641 
00642                 rc = c->ksnc_proto->pro_match_tx(c, tx, nonblk);
00643 
00644                 switch (rc) {
00645                 default:
00646                         LBUG();
00647                 case SOCKNAL_MATCH_NO: /* protocol rejected the tx */
00648                         continue;
00649 
00650                 case SOCKNAL_MATCH_YES: /* typed connection */
00651                         if (typed == NULL || tnob > nob ||
00652                             (tnob == nob && *ksocknal_tunables.ksnd_round_robin &&
00653                              cfs_time_after(typed->ksnc_tx_last_post, c->ksnc_tx_last_post))) {
00654                                 typed = c;
00655                                 tnob  = nob;
00656                         }
00657                         break;
00658 
00659                 case SOCKNAL_MATCH_MAY: /* fallback connection */
00660                         if (fallback == NULL || fnob > nob ||
00661                             (fnob == nob && *ksocknal_tunables.ksnd_round_robin &&
00662                              cfs_time_after(fallback->ksnc_tx_last_post, c->ksnc_tx_last_post))) {
00663                                 fallback = c;
00664                                 fnob     = nob;
00665                         }
00666                         break;
00667                 }
00668         }
00669 
00670         /* prefer the typed selection */
00671         conn = (typed != NULL) ? typed : fallback;
00672 
00673         if (conn != NULL)
00674                 conn->ksnc_tx_last_post = cfs_time_current();
00675 
00676         return conn;
00677 }
00678 
00679 void
00680 ksocknal_tx_prep(ksock_conn_t *conn, ksock_tx_t *tx)
00681 {
00682         conn->ksnc_proto->pro_pack(tx);
00683 
00684         atomic_add (tx->tx_nob, &conn->ksnc_tx_nob);
00685         ksocknal_conn_addref(conn); /* +1 ref for tx */
00686         tx->tx_conn = conn;
00687 }
00688 
00689 void
00690 ksocknal_queue_tx_locked (ksock_tx_t *tx, ksock_conn_t *conn)
00691 {
00692         ksock_sched_t *sched = conn->ksnc_scheduler;
00693         ksock_msg_t   *msg = &tx->tx_msg;
00694         ksock_tx_t    *ztx = NULL;
00695         int            bufnob = 0;
00696 
00697         /* called holding global lock (read or irq-write) and caller may
00698          * not have dropped this lock between finding conn and calling me,
00699          * so we don't need the {get,put}connsock dance to deref
00700          * ksnc_sock... */
00701         LASSERT(!conn->ksnc_closing);
00702 
00703         CDEBUG(D_NET, "Sending to %s ip %pI4h:%d\n",
00704                libcfs_id2str(conn->ksnc_peer->ksnp_id),
00705                &conn->ksnc_ipaddr, conn->ksnc_port);
00706 
00707         ksocknal_tx_prep(conn, tx);
00708 
00709         /* Ensure the frags we've been given EXACTLY match the number of
00710          * bytes we want to send.  Many TCP/IP stacks disregard any total
00711          * size parameters passed to them and just look at the frags.
00712          *
00713          * We always expect at least 1 mapped fragment containing the
00714          * complete ksocknal message header. */
00715         LASSERT (lnet_iov_nob (tx->tx_niov, tx->tx_iov) +
00716                  lnet_kiov_nob(tx->tx_nkiov, tx->tx_kiov) ==
00717                  (unsigned int)tx->tx_nob);
00718         LASSERT (tx->tx_niov >= 1);
00719         LASSERT (tx->tx_resid == tx->tx_nob);
00720 
00721         CDEBUG (D_NET, "Packet %p type %d, nob %d niov %d nkiov %d\n",
00722                 tx, (tx->tx_lnetmsg != NULL) ? tx->tx_lnetmsg->msg_hdr.type:
00723                                                KSOCK_MSG_NOOP,
00724                 tx->tx_nob, tx->tx_niov, tx->tx_nkiov);
00725 
00726         bufnob = conn->ksnc_sock->sk->sk_wmem_queued;
00727         spin_lock_bh(&sched->kss_lock);
00728 
00729         if (list_empty(&conn->ksnc_tx_queue) && bufnob == 0) {
00730                 /* First packet starts the timeout */
00731                 conn->ksnc_tx_deadline =
00732                         cfs_time_shift(*ksocknal_tunables.ksnd_timeout);
00733                 if (conn->ksnc_tx_bufnob > 0) /* something got ACKed */
00734                         conn->ksnc_peer->ksnp_last_alive = cfs_time_current();
00735                 conn->ksnc_tx_bufnob = 0;
00736                 smp_mb(); /* order with adding to tx_queue */
00737         }
00738 
00739         if (msg->ksm_type == KSOCK_MSG_NOOP) {
00740                 /* The packet is noop ZC ACK, try to piggyback the ack_cookie
00741                  * on a normal packet so I don't need to send it */
00742                 LASSERT (msg->ksm_zc_cookies[1] != 0);
00743                 LASSERT (conn->ksnc_proto->pro_queue_tx_zcack != NULL);
00744 
00745                 if (conn->ksnc_proto->pro_queue_tx_zcack(conn, tx, 0))
00746                         ztx = tx; /* ZC ACK piggybacked on ztx release tx later */
00747 
00748         } else {
00749                 /* It's a normal packet - can it piggback a noop zc-ack that
00750                  * has been queued already? */
00751                 LASSERT (msg->ksm_zc_cookies[1] == 0);
00752                 LASSERT (conn->ksnc_proto->pro_queue_tx_msg != NULL);
00753 
00754                 ztx = conn->ksnc_proto->pro_queue_tx_msg(conn, tx);
00755                 /* ztx will be released later */
00756         }
00757 
00758         if (ztx != NULL) {
00759                 atomic_sub (ztx->tx_nob, &conn->ksnc_tx_nob);
00760                 list_add_tail(&ztx->tx_list, &sched->kss_zombie_noop_txs);
00761         }
00762 
00763         if (conn->ksnc_tx_ready &&      /* able to send */
00764             !conn->ksnc_tx_scheduled) { /* not scheduled to send */
00765                 /* +1 ref for scheduler */
00766                 ksocknal_conn_addref(conn);
00767                 list_add_tail(&conn->ksnc_tx_list,
00768                                    &sched->kss_tx_conns);
00769                 conn->ksnc_tx_scheduled = 1;
00770                 wake_up(&sched->kss_waitq);
00771         }
00772 
00773         spin_unlock_bh(&sched->kss_lock);
00774 }
00775 
00776 
00777 ksock_route_t *
00778 ksocknal_find_connectable_route_locked (ksock_peer_t *peer)
00779 {
00780         cfs_time_t     now = cfs_time_current();
00781         struct list_head    *tmp;
00782         ksock_route_t *route;
00783 
00784         list_for_each(tmp, &peer->ksnp_routes) {
00785                 route = list_entry(tmp, ksock_route_t, ksnr_list);
00786 
00787                 LASSERT (!route->ksnr_connecting || route->ksnr_scheduled);
00788 
00789                 if (route->ksnr_scheduled)      /* connections being established */
00790                         continue;
00791 
00792                 /* all route types connected ? */
00793                 if ((ksocknal_route_mask() & ~route->ksnr_connected) == 0)
00794                         continue;
00795 
00796                 if (!(route->ksnr_retry_interval == 0 || /* first attempt */
00797                       cfs_time_aftereq(now, route->ksnr_timeout))) {
00798                         CDEBUG(D_NET,
00799                                "Too soon to retry route %pI4h "
00800                                "(cnted %d, interval %ld, %ld secs later)\n",
00801                                &route->ksnr_ipaddr,
00802                                route->ksnr_connected,
00803                                route->ksnr_retry_interval,
00804                                cfs_duration_sec(route->ksnr_timeout - now));
00805                         continue;
00806                 }
00807 
00808                 return (route);
00809         }
00810 
00811         return (NULL);
00812 }
00813 
00814 ksock_route_t *
00815 ksocknal_find_connecting_route_locked (ksock_peer_t *peer)
00816 {
00817         struct list_head        *tmp;
00818         ksock_route_t     *route;
00819 
00820         list_for_each(tmp, &peer->ksnp_routes) {
00821                 route = list_entry(tmp, ksock_route_t, ksnr_list);
00822 
00823                 LASSERT (!route->ksnr_connecting || route->ksnr_scheduled);
00824 
00825                 if (route->ksnr_scheduled)
00826                         return (route);
00827         }
00828 
00829         return (NULL);
00830 }
00831 
00832 int
00833 ksocknal_launch_packet (lnet_ni_t *ni, ksock_tx_t *tx, lnet_process_id_t id)
00834 {
00835         ksock_peer_t     *peer;
00836         ksock_conn_t     *conn;
00837         rwlock_t     *g_lock;
00838         int               retry;
00839         int               rc;
00840 
00841         LASSERT (tx->tx_conn == NULL);
00842 
00843         g_lock = &ksocknal_data.ksnd_global_lock;
00844 
00845         for (retry = 0;; retry = 1) {
00846                 read_lock(g_lock);
00847                 peer = ksocknal_find_peer_locked(ni, id);
00848                 if (peer != NULL) {
00849                         if (ksocknal_find_connectable_route_locked(peer) == NULL) {
00850                                 conn = ksocknal_find_conn_locked(peer, tx, tx->tx_nonblk);
00851                                 if (conn != NULL) {
00852                                         /* I've got no routes that need to be
00853                                          * connecting and I do have an actual
00854                                          * connection... */
00855                                         ksocknal_queue_tx_locked (tx, conn);
00856                                         read_unlock(g_lock);
00857                                         return (0);
00858                                 }
00859                         }
00860                 }
00861 
00862                 /* I'll need a write lock... */
00863                 read_unlock(g_lock);
00864 
00865                 write_lock_bh(g_lock);
00866 
00867                 peer = ksocknal_find_peer_locked(ni, id);
00868                 if (peer != NULL)
00869                         break;
00870 
00871                 write_unlock_bh(g_lock);
00872 
00873                 if ((id.pid & LNET_PID_USERFLAG) != 0) {
00874                         CERROR("Refusing to create a connection to "
00875                                "userspace process %s\n", libcfs_id2str(id));
00876                         return -EHOSTUNREACH;
00877                 }
00878 
00879                 if (retry) {
00880                         CERROR("Can't find peer %s\n", libcfs_id2str(id));
00881                         return -EHOSTUNREACH;
00882                 }
00883 
00884                 rc = ksocknal_add_peer(ni, id,
00885                                        LNET_NIDADDR(id.nid),
00886                                        lnet_acceptor_port());
00887                 if (rc != 0) {
00888                         CERROR("Can't add peer %s: %d\n",
00889                                libcfs_id2str(id), rc);
00890                         return rc;
00891                 }
00892         }
00893 
00894         ksocknal_launch_all_connections_locked(peer);
00895 
00896         conn = ksocknal_find_conn_locked(peer, tx, tx->tx_nonblk);
00897         if (conn != NULL) {
00898                 /* Connection exists; queue message on it */
00899                 ksocknal_queue_tx_locked (tx, conn);
00900                 write_unlock_bh(g_lock);
00901                 return (0);
00902         }
00903 
00904         if (peer->ksnp_accepting > 0 ||
00905             ksocknal_find_connecting_route_locked (peer) != NULL) {
00906                 /* the message is going to be pinned to the peer */
00907                 tx->tx_deadline =
00908                         cfs_time_shift(*ksocknal_tunables.ksnd_timeout);
00909 
00910                 /* Queue the message until a connection is established */
00911                 list_add_tail(&tx->tx_list, &peer->ksnp_tx_queue);
00912                 write_unlock_bh(g_lock);
00913                 return 0;
00914         }
00915 
00916         write_unlock_bh(g_lock);
00917 
00918         /* NB Routes may be ignored if connections to them failed recently */
00919         CNETERR("No usable routes to %s\n", libcfs_id2str(id));
00920         return (-EHOSTUNREACH);
00921 }
00922 
00923 int
00924 ksocknal_send(lnet_ni_t *ni, void *private, lnet_msg_t *lntmsg)
00925 {
00926         int               mpflag = 1;
00927         int               type = lntmsg->msg_type;
00928         lnet_process_id_t target = lntmsg->msg_target;
00929         unsigned int      payload_niov = lntmsg->msg_niov;
00930         struct kvec *payload_iov = lntmsg->msg_iov;
00931         lnet_kiov_t      *payload_kiov = lntmsg->msg_kiov;
00932         unsigned int      payload_offset = lntmsg->msg_offset;
00933         unsigned int      payload_nob = lntmsg->msg_len;
00934         ksock_tx_t       *tx;
00935         int               desc_size;
00936         int               rc;
00937 
00938         /* NB 'private' is different depending on what we're sending.
00939          * Just ignore it... */
00940 
00941         CDEBUG(D_NET, "sending %u bytes in %d frags to %s\n",
00942                payload_nob, payload_niov, libcfs_id2str(target));
00943 
00944         LASSERT (payload_nob == 0 || payload_niov > 0);
00945         LASSERT (payload_niov <= LNET_MAX_IOV);
00946         /* payload is either all vaddrs or all pages */
00947         LASSERT (!(payload_kiov != NULL && payload_iov != NULL));
00948         LASSERT (!in_interrupt ());
00949 
00950         if (payload_iov != NULL)
00951                 desc_size = offsetof(ksock_tx_t,
00952                                      tx_frags.virt.iov[1 + payload_niov]);
00953         else
00954                 desc_size = offsetof(ksock_tx_t,
00955                                      tx_frags.paged.kiov[payload_niov]);
00956 
00957         if (lntmsg->msg_vmflush)
00958                 mpflag = cfs_memory_pressure_get_and_set();
00959         tx = ksocknal_alloc_tx(KSOCK_MSG_LNET, desc_size);
00960         if (tx == NULL) {
00961                 CERROR("Can't allocate tx desc type %d size %d\n",
00962                        type, desc_size);
00963                 if (lntmsg->msg_vmflush)
00964                         cfs_memory_pressure_restore(mpflag);
00965                 return (-ENOMEM);
00966         }
00967 
00968         tx->tx_conn = NULL;                     /* set when assigned a conn */
00969         tx->tx_lnetmsg = lntmsg;
00970 
00971         if (payload_iov != NULL) {
00972                 tx->tx_kiov = NULL;
00973                 tx->tx_nkiov = 0;
00974                 tx->tx_iov = tx->tx_frags.virt.iov;
00975                 tx->tx_niov = 1 +
00976                               lnet_extract_iov(payload_niov, &tx->tx_iov[1],
00977                                                payload_niov, payload_iov,
00978                                                payload_offset, payload_nob);
00979         } else {
00980                 tx->tx_niov = 1;
00981                 tx->tx_iov = &tx->tx_frags.paged.iov;
00982                 tx->tx_kiov = tx->tx_frags.paged.kiov;
00983                 tx->tx_nkiov = lnet_extract_kiov(payload_niov, tx->tx_kiov,
00984                                                  payload_niov, payload_kiov,
00985                                                  payload_offset, payload_nob);
00986 
00987                 if (payload_nob >= *ksocknal_tunables.ksnd_zc_min_payload)
00988                         tx->tx_zc_capable = 1;
00989         }
00990 
00991         socklnd_init_msg(&tx->tx_msg, KSOCK_MSG_LNET);
00992 
00993         /* The first fragment will be set later in pro_pack */
00994         rc = ksocknal_launch_packet(ni, tx, target);
00995         if (!mpflag)
00996                 cfs_memory_pressure_restore(mpflag);
00997 
00998         if (rc == 0)
00999                 return (0);
01000 
01001         ksocknal_free_tx(tx);
01002         return (-EIO);
01003 }
01004 
01005 int
01006 ksocknal_thread_start(int (*fn)(void *arg), void *arg, char *name)
01007 {
01008         struct task_struct *task = kthread_run(fn, arg, name);
01009 
01010         if (IS_ERR(task))
01011                 return PTR_ERR(task);
01012 
01013         write_lock_bh(&ksocknal_data.ksnd_global_lock);
01014         ksocknal_data.ksnd_nthreads++;
01015         write_unlock_bh(&ksocknal_data.ksnd_global_lock);
01016         return 0;
01017 }
01018 
01019 void
01020 ksocknal_thread_fini (void)
01021 {
01022         write_lock_bh(&ksocknal_data.ksnd_global_lock);
01023         ksocknal_data.ksnd_nthreads--;
01024         write_unlock_bh(&ksocknal_data.ksnd_global_lock);
01025 }
01026 
01027 int
01028 ksocknal_new_packet (ksock_conn_t *conn, int nob_to_skip)
01029 {
01030         static char ksocknal_slop_buffer[4096];
01031 
01032         int            nob;
01033         unsigned int   niov;
01034         int            skipped;
01035 
01036         LASSERT(conn->ksnc_proto != NULL);
01037 
01038         if ((*ksocknal_tunables.ksnd_eager_ack & conn->ksnc_type) != 0) {
01039                 /* Remind the socket to ack eagerly... */
01040                 ksocknal_lib_eager_ack(conn);
01041         }
01042 
01043         if (nob_to_skip == 0) {         /* right at next packet boundary now */
01044                 conn->ksnc_rx_started = 0;
01045                 smp_mb();                       /* racing with timeout thread */
01046 
01047                 switch (conn->ksnc_proto->pro_version) {
01048                 case  KSOCK_PROTO_V2:
01049                 case  KSOCK_PROTO_V3:
01050                         conn->ksnc_rx_state = SOCKNAL_RX_KSM_HEADER;
01051                         conn->ksnc_rx_iov = (struct kvec *)&conn->ksnc_rx_iov_space;
01052                         conn->ksnc_rx_iov[0].iov_base = (char *)&conn->ksnc_msg;
01053 
01054                         conn->ksnc_rx_nob_wanted = offsetof(ksock_msg_t, ksm_u);
01055                         conn->ksnc_rx_nob_left = offsetof(ksock_msg_t, ksm_u);
01056                         conn->ksnc_rx_iov[0].iov_len  = offsetof(ksock_msg_t, ksm_u);
01057                         break;
01058 
01059                 case KSOCK_PROTO_V1:
01060                         /* Receiving bare lnet_hdr_t */
01061                         conn->ksnc_rx_state = SOCKNAL_RX_LNET_HEADER;
01062                         conn->ksnc_rx_nob_wanted = sizeof(lnet_hdr_t);
01063                         conn->ksnc_rx_nob_left = sizeof(lnet_hdr_t);
01064 
01065                         conn->ksnc_rx_iov = (struct kvec *)&conn->ksnc_rx_iov_space;
01066                         conn->ksnc_rx_iov[0].iov_base = (char *)&conn->ksnc_msg.ksm_u.lnetmsg;
01067                         conn->ksnc_rx_iov[0].iov_len  = sizeof (lnet_hdr_t);
01068                         break;
01069 
01070                 default:
01071                         LBUG ();
01072                 }
01073                 conn->ksnc_rx_niov = 1;
01074 
01075                 conn->ksnc_rx_kiov = NULL;
01076                 conn->ksnc_rx_nkiov = 0;
01077                 conn->ksnc_rx_csum = ~0;
01078                 return (1);
01079         }
01080 
01081         /* Set up to skip as much as possible now.  If there's more left
01082          * (ran out of iov entries) we'll get called again */
01083 
01084         conn->ksnc_rx_state = SOCKNAL_RX_SLOP;
01085         conn->ksnc_rx_nob_left = nob_to_skip;
01086         conn->ksnc_rx_iov = (struct kvec *)&conn->ksnc_rx_iov_space;
01087         skipped = 0;
01088         niov = 0;
01089 
01090         do {
01091                 nob = MIN (nob_to_skip, sizeof (ksocknal_slop_buffer));
01092 
01093                 conn->ksnc_rx_iov[niov].iov_base = ksocknal_slop_buffer;
01094                 conn->ksnc_rx_iov[niov].iov_len  = nob;
01095                 niov++;
01096                 skipped += nob;
01097                 nob_to_skip -=nob;
01098 
01099         } while (nob_to_skip != 0 &&    /* mustn't overflow conn's rx iov */
01100                  niov < sizeof(conn->ksnc_rx_iov_space) / sizeof(struct kvec));
01101 
01102         conn->ksnc_rx_niov = niov;
01103         conn->ksnc_rx_kiov = NULL;
01104         conn->ksnc_rx_nkiov = 0;
01105         conn->ksnc_rx_nob_wanted = skipped;
01106         return (0);
01107 }
01108 
01109 static int
01110 ksocknal_process_receive (ksock_conn_t *conn)
01111 {
01112         lnet_hdr_t        *lhdr;
01113         lnet_process_id_t *id;
01114         int                rc;
01115 
01116         LASSERT (atomic_read(&conn->ksnc_conn_refcount) > 0);
01117 
01118         /* NB: sched lock NOT held */
01119         /* SOCKNAL_RX_LNET_HEADER is here for backward compatibility */
01120         LASSERT (conn->ksnc_rx_state == SOCKNAL_RX_KSM_HEADER ||
01121                  conn->ksnc_rx_state == SOCKNAL_RX_LNET_PAYLOAD ||
01122                  conn->ksnc_rx_state == SOCKNAL_RX_LNET_HEADER ||
01123                  conn->ksnc_rx_state == SOCKNAL_RX_SLOP);
01124  again:
01125         if (conn->ksnc_rx_nob_wanted != 0) {
01126                 rc = ksocknal_receive(conn);
01127 
01128                 if (rc <= 0) {
01129                         lnet_process_id_t ksnp_id = conn->ksnc_peer->ksnp_id;
01130 
01131                         LASSERT(rc != -EAGAIN);
01132 
01133                         if (rc == 0)
01134                                 CDEBUG(D_NET, "[%p] EOF from %s "
01135                                        "ip %pI4h:%d\n", conn,
01136                                         libcfs_id2str(ksnp_id),
01137                                         &conn->ksnc_ipaddr,
01138                                         conn->ksnc_port);
01139                         else if (!conn->ksnc_closing)
01140                                 CERROR("[%p] Error %d on read from %s "
01141                                        "ip %pI4h:%d\n", conn, rc,
01142                                        libcfs_id2str(ksnp_id),
01143                                        &conn->ksnc_ipaddr,
01144                                        conn->ksnc_port);
01145 
01146                         /* it's not an error if conn is being closed */
01147                         ksocknal_close_conn_and_siblings (conn,
01148                                                           (conn->ksnc_closing) ? 0 : rc);
01149                         return (rc == 0 ? -ESHUTDOWN : rc);
01150                 }
01151 
01152                 if (conn->ksnc_rx_nob_wanted != 0) {
01153                         /* short read */
01154                         return (-EAGAIN);
01155                 }
01156         }
01157         switch (conn->ksnc_rx_state) {
01158         case SOCKNAL_RX_KSM_HEADER:
01159                 if (conn->ksnc_flip) {
01160                         __swab32s(&conn->ksnc_msg.ksm_type);
01161                         __swab32s(&conn->ksnc_msg.ksm_csum);
01162                         __swab64s(&conn->ksnc_msg.ksm_zc_cookies[0]);
01163                         __swab64s(&conn->ksnc_msg.ksm_zc_cookies[1]);
01164                 }
01165 
01166                 if (conn->ksnc_msg.ksm_type != KSOCK_MSG_NOOP &&
01167                     conn->ksnc_msg.ksm_type != KSOCK_MSG_LNET) {
01168                         CERROR("%s: Unknown message type: %x\n",
01169                                libcfs_id2str(conn->ksnc_peer->ksnp_id),
01170                                conn->ksnc_msg.ksm_type);
01171                         ksocknal_new_packet(conn, 0);
01172                         ksocknal_close_conn_and_siblings(conn, -EPROTO);
01173                         return (-EPROTO);
01174                 }
01175 
01176                 if (conn->ksnc_msg.ksm_type == KSOCK_MSG_NOOP &&
01177                     conn->ksnc_msg.ksm_csum != 0 &&     /* has checksum */
01178                     conn->ksnc_msg.ksm_csum != conn->ksnc_rx_csum) {
01179                         /* NOOP Checksum error */
01180                         CERROR("%s: Checksum error, wire:0x%08X data:0x%08X\n",
01181                                libcfs_id2str(conn->ksnc_peer->ksnp_id),
01182                                conn->ksnc_msg.ksm_csum, conn->ksnc_rx_csum);
01183                         ksocknal_new_packet(conn, 0);
01184                         ksocknal_close_conn_and_siblings(conn, -EPROTO);
01185                         return (-EIO);
01186                 }
01187 
01188                 if (conn->ksnc_msg.ksm_zc_cookies[1] != 0) {
01189                         __u64 cookie = 0;
01190 
01191                         LASSERT (conn->ksnc_proto != &ksocknal_protocol_v1x);
01192 
01193                         if (conn->ksnc_msg.ksm_type == KSOCK_MSG_NOOP)
01194                                 cookie = conn->ksnc_msg.ksm_zc_cookies[0];
01195 
01196                         rc = conn->ksnc_proto->pro_handle_zcack(conn, cookie,
01197                                                conn->ksnc_msg.ksm_zc_cookies[1]);
01198 
01199                         if (rc != 0) {
01200                                 CERROR("%s: Unknown ZC-ACK cookie: "LPU64", "LPU64"\n",
01201                                        libcfs_id2str(conn->ksnc_peer->ksnp_id),
01202                                        cookie, conn->ksnc_msg.ksm_zc_cookies[1]);
01203                                 ksocknal_new_packet(conn, 0);
01204                                 ksocknal_close_conn_and_siblings(conn, -EPROTO);
01205                                 return (rc);
01206                         }
01207                 }
01208 
01209                 if (conn->ksnc_msg.ksm_type == KSOCK_MSG_NOOP) {
01210                         ksocknal_new_packet (conn, 0);
01211                         return 0;       /* NOOP is done and just return */
01212                 }
01213 
01214                 conn->ksnc_rx_state = SOCKNAL_RX_LNET_HEADER;
01215                 conn->ksnc_rx_nob_wanted = sizeof(ksock_lnet_msg_t);
01216                 conn->ksnc_rx_nob_left = sizeof(ksock_lnet_msg_t);
01217 
01218                 conn->ksnc_rx_iov = (struct kvec *)&conn->ksnc_rx_iov_space;
01219                 conn->ksnc_rx_iov[0].iov_base = (char *)&conn->ksnc_msg.ksm_u.lnetmsg;
01220                 conn->ksnc_rx_iov[0].iov_len  = sizeof(ksock_lnet_msg_t);
01221 
01222                 conn->ksnc_rx_niov = 1;
01223                 conn->ksnc_rx_kiov = NULL;
01224                 conn->ksnc_rx_nkiov = 0;
01225 
01226                 goto again;     /* read lnet header now */
01227 
01228         case SOCKNAL_RX_LNET_HEADER:
01229                 /* unpack message header */
01230                 conn->ksnc_proto->pro_unpack(&conn->ksnc_msg);
01231 
01232                 if ((conn->ksnc_peer->ksnp_id.pid & LNET_PID_USERFLAG) != 0) {
01233                         /* Userspace peer */
01234                         lhdr = &conn->ksnc_msg.ksm_u.lnetmsg.ksnm_hdr;
01235                         id   = &conn->ksnc_peer->ksnp_id;
01236 
01237                         /* Substitute process ID assigned at connection time */
01238                         lhdr->src_pid = cpu_to_le32(id->pid);
01239                         lhdr->src_nid = cpu_to_le64(id->nid);
01240                 }
01241 
01242                 conn->ksnc_rx_state = SOCKNAL_RX_PARSE;
01243                 ksocknal_conn_addref(conn);     /* ++ref while parsing */
01244 
01245                 rc = lnet_parse(conn->ksnc_peer->ksnp_ni,
01246                                 &conn->ksnc_msg.ksm_u.lnetmsg.ksnm_hdr,
01247                                 conn->ksnc_peer->ksnp_id.nid, conn, 0);
01248                 if (rc < 0) {
01249                         /* I just received garbage: give up on this conn */
01250                         ksocknal_new_packet(conn, 0);
01251                         ksocknal_close_conn_and_siblings (conn, rc);
01252                         ksocknal_conn_decref(conn);
01253                         return (-EPROTO);
01254                 }
01255 
01256                 /* I'm racing with ksocknal_recv() */
01257                 LASSERT (conn->ksnc_rx_state == SOCKNAL_RX_PARSE ||
01258                          conn->ksnc_rx_state == SOCKNAL_RX_LNET_PAYLOAD);
01259 
01260                 if (conn->ksnc_rx_state != SOCKNAL_RX_LNET_PAYLOAD)
01261                         return 0;
01262 
01263                 /* ksocknal_recv() got called */
01264                 goto again;
01265 
01266         case SOCKNAL_RX_LNET_PAYLOAD:
01267                 /* payload all received */
01268                 rc = 0;
01269 
01270                 if (conn->ksnc_rx_nob_left == 0 &&   /* not truncating */
01271                     conn->ksnc_msg.ksm_csum != 0 &&  /* has checksum */
01272                     conn->ksnc_msg.ksm_csum != conn->ksnc_rx_csum) {
01273                         CERROR("%s: Checksum error, wire:0x%08X data:0x%08X\n",
01274                                libcfs_id2str(conn->ksnc_peer->ksnp_id),
01275                                conn->ksnc_msg.ksm_csum, conn->ksnc_rx_csum);
01276                         rc = -EIO;
01277                 }
01278 
01279                 if (rc == 0 && conn->ksnc_msg.ksm_zc_cookies[0] != 0) {
01280                         LASSERT(conn->ksnc_proto != &ksocknal_protocol_v1x);
01281 
01282                         lhdr = &conn->ksnc_msg.ksm_u.lnetmsg.ksnm_hdr;
01283                         id   = &conn->ksnc_peer->ksnp_id;
01284 
01285                         rc = conn->ksnc_proto->pro_handle_zcreq(conn,
01286                                         conn->ksnc_msg.ksm_zc_cookies[0],
01287                                         *ksocknal_tunables.ksnd_nonblk_zcack ||
01288                                         le64_to_cpu(lhdr->src_nid) != id->nid);
01289                 }
01290 
01291                 lnet_finalize(conn->ksnc_peer->ksnp_ni, conn->ksnc_cookie, rc);
01292 
01293                 if (rc != 0) {
01294                         ksocknal_new_packet(conn, 0);
01295                         ksocknal_close_conn_and_siblings (conn, rc);
01296                         return (-EPROTO);
01297                 }
01298                 /* Fall through */
01299 
01300         case SOCKNAL_RX_SLOP:
01301                 /* starting new packet? */
01302                 if (ksocknal_new_packet (conn, conn->ksnc_rx_nob_left))
01303                         return 0;       /* come back later */
01304                 goto again;             /* try to finish reading slop now */
01305 
01306         default:
01307                 break;
01308         }
01309 
01310         /* Not Reached */
01311         LBUG ();
01312         return (-EINVAL);                       /* keep gcc happy */
01313 }
01314 
01315 int
01316 ksocknal_recv (lnet_ni_t *ni, void *private, lnet_msg_t *msg, int delayed,
01317                unsigned int niov, struct kvec *iov, lnet_kiov_t *kiov,
01318                unsigned int offset, unsigned int mlen, unsigned int rlen)
01319 {
01320         ksock_conn_t  *conn = (ksock_conn_t *)private;
01321         ksock_sched_t *sched = conn->ksnc_scheduler;
01322 
01323         LASSERT (mlen <= rlen);
01324         LASSERT (niov <= LNET_MAX_IOV);
01325 
01326         conn->ksnc_cookie = msg;
01327         conn->ksnc_rx_nob_wanted = mlen;
01328         conn->ksnc_rx_nob_left   = rlen;
01329 
01330         if (mlen == 0 || iov != NULL) {
01331                 conn->ksnc_rx_nkiov = 0;
01332                 conn->ksnc_rx_kiov = NULL;
01333                 conn->ksnc_rx_iov = conn->ksnc_rx_iov_space.iov;
01334                 conn->ksnc_rx_niov =
01335                         lnet_extract_iov(LNET_MAX_IOV, conn->ksnc_rx_iov,
01336                                          niov, iov, offset, mlen);
01337         } else {
01338                 conn->ksnc_rx_niov = 0;
01339                 conn->ksnc_rx_iov  = NULL;
01340                 conn->ksnc_rx_kiov = conn->ksnc_rx_iov_space.kiov;
01341                 conn->ksnc_rx_nkiov =
01342                         lnet_extract_kiov(LNET_MAX_IOV, conn->ksnc_rx_kiov,
01343                                           niov, kiov, offset, mlen);
01344         }
01345 
01346         LASSERT (mlen ==
01347                  lnet_iov_nob (conn->ksnc_rx_niov, conn->ksnc_rx_iov) +
01348                  lnet_kiov_nob (conn->ksnc_rx_nkiov, conn->ksnc_rx_kiov));
01349 
01350         LASSERT (conn->ksnc_rx_scheduled);
01351 
01352         spin_lock_bh(&sched->kss_lock);
01353 
01354         switch (conn->ksnc_rx_state) {
01355         case SOCKNAL_RX_PARSE_WAIT:
01356                 list_add_tail(&conn->ksnc_rx_list, &sched->kss_rx_conns);
01357                 wake_up(&sched->kss_waitq);
01358                 LASSERT(conn->ksnc_rx_ready);
01359                 break;
01360 
01361         case SOCKNAL_RX_PARSE:
01362                 /* scheduler hasn't noticed I'm parsing yet */
01363                 break;
01364         }
01365 
01366         conn->ksnc_rx_state = SOCKNAL_RX_LNET_PAYLOAD;
01367 
01368         spin_unlock_bh(&sched->kss_lock);
01369         ksocknal_conn_decref(conn);
01370         return 0;
01371 }
01372 
01373 static inline int
01374 ksocknal_sched_cansleep(ksock_sched_t *sched)
01375 {
01376         int           rc;
01377 
01378         spin_lock_bh(&sched->kss_lock);
01379 
01380         rc = (!ksocknal_data.ksnd_shuttingdown &&
01381               list_empty(&sched->kss_rx_conns) &&
01382               list_empty(&sched->kss_tx_conns));
01383 
01384         spin_unlock_bh(&sched->kss_lock);
01385         return rc;
01386 }
01387 
01388 int ksocknal_scheduler(void *arg)
01389 {
01390         struct ksock_sched_info *info;
01391         ksock_sched_t           *sched;
01392         ksock_conn_t            *conn;
01393         ksock_tx_t              *tx;
01394         int                     rc;
01395         int                     nloops = 0;
01396         long                    id = (long)arg;
01397 
01398         info = ksocknal_data.ksnd_sched_info[KSOCK_THREAD_CPT(id)];
01399         sched = &info->ksi_scheds[KSOCK_THREAD_SID(id)];
01400 
01401         cfs_block_allsigs();
01402 
01403         rc = cfs_cpt_bind(lnet_cpt_table(), info->ksi_cpt);
01404         if (rc != 0) {
01405                 CERROR("Can't set CPT affinity to %d: %d\n",
01406                        info->ksi_cpt, rc);
01407         }
01408 
01409         spin_lock_bh(&sched->kss_lock);
01410 
01411         while (!ksocknal_data.ksnd_shuttingdown) {
01412                 int did_something = 0;
01413 
01414                 /* Ensure I progress everything semi-fairly */
01415 
01416                 if (!list_empty(&sched->kss_rx_conns)) {
01417                         conn = list_entry(sched->kss_rx_conns.next,
01418                                               ksock_conn_t, ksnc_rx_list);
01419                         list_del(&conn->ksnc_rx_list);
01420 
01421                         LASSERT(conn->ksnc_rx_scheduled);
01422                         LASSERT(conn->ksnc_rx_ready);
01423 
01424                         /* clear rx_ready in case receive isn't complete.
01425                          * Do it BEFORE we call process_recv, since
01426                          * data_ready can set it any time after we release
01427                          * kss_lock. */
01428                         conn->ksnc_rx_ready = 0;
01429                         spin_unlock_bh(&sched->kss_lock);
01430 
01431                         rc = ksocknal_process_receive(conn);
01432 
01433                         spin_lock_bh(&sched->kss_lock);
01434 
01435                         /* I'm the only one that can clear this flag */
01436                         LASSERT(conn->ksnc_rx_scheduled);
01437 
01438                         /* Did process_receive get everything it wanted? */
01439                         if (rc == 0)
01440                                 conn->ksnc_rx_ready = 1;
01441 
01442                         if (conn->ksnc_rx_state == SOCKNAL_RX_PARSE) {
01443                                 /* Conn blocked waiting for ksocknal_recv()
01444                                  * I change its state (under lock) to signal
01445                                  * it can be rescheduled */
01446                                 conn->ksnc_rx_state = SOCKNAL_RX_PARSE_WAIT;
01447                         } else if (conn->ksnc_rx_ready) {
01448                                 /* reschedule for rx */
01449                                 list_add_tail(&conn->ksnc_rx_list,
01450                                                    &sched->kss_rx_conns);
01451                         } else {
01452                                 conn->ksnc_rx_scheduled = 0;
01453                                 /* drop my ref */
01454                                 ksocknal_conn_decref(conn);
01455                         }
01456 
01457                         did_something = 1;
01458                 }
01459 
01460                 if (!list_empty(&sched->kss_tx_conns)) {
01461                         struct list_head zlist = LIST_HEAD_INIT(zlist);
01462 
01463                         if (!list_empty(&sched->kss_zombie_noop_txs)) {
01464                                 list_add(&zlist,
01465                                              &sched->kss_zombie_noop_txs);
01466                                 list_del_init(&sched->kss_zombie_noop_txs);
01467                         }
01468 
01469                         conn = list_entry(sched->kss_tx_conns.next,
01470                                               ksock_conn_t, ksnc_tx_list);
01471                         list_del(&conn->ksnc_tx_list);
01472 
01473                         LASSERT(conn->ksnc_tx_scheduled);
01474                         LASSERT(conn->ksnc_tx_ready);
01475                         LASSERT(!list_empty(&conn->ksnc_tx_queue));
01476 
01477                         tx = list_entry(conn->ksnc_tx_queue.next,
01478                                             ksock_tx_t, tx_list);
01479 
01480                         if (conn->ksnc_tx_carrier == tx)
01481                                 ksocknal_next_tx_carrier(conn);
01482 
01483                         /* dequeue now so empty list => more to send */
01484                         list_del(&tx->tx_list);
01485 
01486                         /* Clear tx_ready in case send isn't complete.  Do
01487                          * it BEFORE we call process_transmit, since
01488                          * write_space can set it any time after we release
01489                          * kss_lock. */
01490                         conn->ksnc_tx_ready = 0;
01491                         spin_unlock_bh(&sched->kss_lock);
01492 
01493                         if (!list_empty(&zlist)) {
01494                                 /* free zombie noop txs, it's fast because
01495                                  * noop txs are just put in freelist */
01496                                 ksocknal_txlist_done(NULL, &zlist, 0);
01497                         }
01498 
01499                         rc = ksocknal_process_transmit(conn, tx);
01500 
01501                         if (rc == -ENOMEM || rc == -EAGAIN) {
01502                                 /* Incomplete send: replace tx on HEAD of tx_queue */
01503                                 spin_lock_bh(&sched->kss_lock);
01504                                 list_add(&tx->tx_list,
01505                                              &conn->ksnc_tx_queue);
01506                         } else {
01507                                 /* Complete send; tx -ref */
01508                                 ksocknal_tx_decref(tx);
01509 
01510                                 spin_lock_bh(&sched->kss_lock);
01511                                 /* assume space for more */
01512                                 conn->ksnc_tx_ready = 1;
01513                         }
01514 
01515                         if (rc == -ENOMEM) {
01516                                 /* Do nothing; after a short timeout, this
01517                                  * conn will be reposted on kss_tx_conns. */
01518                         } else if (conn->ksnc_tx_ready &&
01519                                    !list_empty(&conn->ksnc_tx_queue)) {
01520                                 /* reschedule for tx */
01521                                 list_add_tail(&conn->ksnc_tx_list,
01522                                                    &sched->kss_tx_conns);
01523                         } else {
01524                                 conn->ksnc_tx_scheduled = 0;
01525                                 /* drop my ref */
01526                                 ksocknal_conn_decref(conn);
01527                         }
01528 
01529                         did_something = 1;
01530                 }
01531                 if (!did_something ||           /* nothing to do */
01532                     ++nloops == SOCKNAL_RESCHED) { /* hogging CPU? */
01533                         spin_unlock_bh(&sched->kss_lock);
01534 
01535                         nloops = 0;
01536 
01537                         if (!did_something) {   /* wait for something to do */
01538                                 rc = wait_event_interruptible_exclusive(
01539                                         sched->kss_waitq,
01540                                         !ksocknal_sched_cansleep(sched));
01541                                 LASSERT (rc == 0);
01542                         } else {
01543                                 cond_resched();
01544                         }
01545 
01546                         spin_lock_bh(&sched->kss_lock);
01547                 }
01548         }
01549 
01550         spin_unlock_bh(&sched->kss_lock);
01551         ksocknal_thread_fini();
01552         return 0;
01553 }
01554 
01555 /*
01556  * Add connection to kss_rx_conns of scheduler
01557  * and wakeup the scheduler.
01558  */
01559 void ksocknal_read_callback (ksock_conn_t *conn)
01560 {
01561         ksock_sched_t *sched;
01562         ENTRY;
01563 
01564         sched = conn->ksnc_scheduler;
01565 
01566         spin_lock_bh(&sched->kss_lock);
01567 
01568         conn->ksnc_rx_ready = 1;
01569 
01570         if (!conn->ksnc_rx_scheduled) {  /* not being progressed */
01571                 list_add_tail(&conn->ksnc_rx_list,
01572                                   &sched->kss_rx_conns);
01573                 conn->ksnc_rx_scheduled = 1;
01574                 /* extra ref for scheduler */
01575                 ksocknal_conn_addref(conn);
01576 
01577                 wake_up (&sched->kss_waitq);
01578         }
01579         spin_unlock_bh(&sched->kss_lock);
01580 
01581         EXIT;
01582 }
01583 
01584 /*
01585  * Add connection to kss_tx_conns of scheduler
01586  * and wakeup the scheduler.
01587  */
01588 void ksocknal_write_callback(ksock_conn_t *conn)
01589 {
01590         ksock_sched_t *sched;
01591         ENTRY;
01592 
01593         sched = conn->ksnc_scheduler;
01594 
01595         spin_lock_bh(&sched->kss_lock);
01596 
01597         conn->ksnc_tx_ready = 1;
01598 
01599         if (!conn->ksnc_tx_scheduled && /* not being progressed */
01600             !list_empty(&conn->ksnc_tx_queue)) { /* packets to send */
01601                 list_add_tail(&conn->ksnc_tx_list, &sched->kss_tx_conns);
01602                 conn->ksnc_tx_scheduled = 1;
01603                 /* extra ref for scheduler */
01604                 ksocknal_conn_addref(conn);
01605 
01606                 wake_up(&sched->kss_waitq);
01607         }
01608 
01609         spin_unlock_bh(&sched->kss_lock);
01610 
01611         EXIT;
01612 }
01613 
01614 static ksock_proto_t *
01615 ksocknal_parse_proto_version (ksock_hello_msg_t *hello)
01616 {
01617         __u32   version = 0;
01618 
01619         if (hello->kshm_magic == LNET_PROTO_MAGIC)
01620                 version = hello->kshm_version;
01621         else if (hello->kshm_magic == __swab32(LNET_PROTO_MAGIC))
01622                 version = __swab32(hello->kshm_version);
01623 
01624         if (version != 0) {
01625 #if SOCKNAL_VERSION_DEBUG
01626                 if (*ksocknal_tunables.ksnd_protocol == 1)
01627                         return NULL;
01628 
01629                 if (*ksocknal_tunables.ksnd_protocol == 2 &&
01630                     version == KSOCK_PROTO_V3)
01631                         return NULL;
01632 #endif
01633                 if (version == KSOCK_PROTO_V2)
01634                         return &ksocknal_protocol_v2x;
01635 
01636                 if (version == KSOCK_PROTO_V3)
01637                         return &ksocknal_protocol_v3x;
01638 
01639                 return NULL;
01640         }
01641 
01642         if (hello->kshm_magic == le32_to_cpu(LNET_PROTO_TCP_MAGIC)) {
01643                 lnet_magicversion_t *hmv = (lnet_magicversion_t *)hello;
01644 
01645                 CLASSERT (sizeof (lnet_magicversion_t) ==
01646                           offsetof (ksock_hello_msg_t, kshm_src_nid));
01647 
01648                 if (hmv->version_major == cpu_to_le16 (KSOCK_PROTO_V1_MAJOR) &&
01649                     hmv->version_minor == cpu_to_le16 (KSOCK_PROTO_V1_MINOR))
01650                         return &ksocknal_protocol_v1x;
01651         }
01652 
01653         return NULL;
01654 }
01655 
01656 int
01657 ksocknal_send_hello (lnet_ni_t *ni, ksock_conn_t *conn,
01658                      lnet_nid_t peer_nid, ksock_hello_msg_t *hello)
01659 {
01660         /* CAVEAT EMPTOR: this byte flips 'ipaddrs' */
01661         ksock_net_t         *net = (ksock_net_t *)ni->ni_data;
01662 
01663         LASSERT (hello->kshm_nips <= LNET_MAX_INTERFACES);
01664 
01665         /* rely on caller to hold a ref on socket so it wouldn't disappear */
01666         LASSERT (conn->ksnc_proto != NULL);
01667 
01668         hello->kshm_src_nid         = ni->ni_nid;
01669         hello->kshm_dst_nid         = peer_nid;
01670         hello->kshm_src_pid         = the_lnet.ln_pid;
01671 
01672         hello->kshm_src_incarnation = net->ksnn_incarnation;
01673         hello->kshm_ctype           = conn->ksnc_type;
01674 
01675         return conn->ksnc_proto->pro_send_hello(conn, hello);
01676 }
01677 
01678 static int
01679 ksocknal_invert_type(int type)
01680 {
01681         switch (type)
01682         {
01683         case SOCKLND_CONN_ANY:
01684         case SOCKLND_CONN_CONTROL:
01685                 return (type);
01686         case SOCKLND_CONN_BULK_IN:
01687                 return SOCKLND_CONN_BULK_OUT;
01688         case SOCKLND_CONN_BULK_OUT:
01689                 return SOCKLND_CONN_BULK_IN;
01690         default:
01691                 return (SOCKLND_CONN_NONE);
01692         }
01693 }
01694 
01695 int
01696 ksocknal_recv_hello (lnet_ni_t *ni, ksock_conn_t *conn,
01697                      ksock_hello_msg_t *hello, lnet_process_id_t *peerid,
01698                      __u64 *incarnation)
01699 {
01700         /* Return < 0        fatal error
01701          *        0          success
01702          *        EALREADY   lost connection race
01703          *        EPROTO     protocol version mismatch
01704          */
01705         struct socket        *sock = conn->ksnc_sock;
01706         int                  active = (conn->ksnc_proto != NULL);
01707         int                  timeout;
01708         int                  proto_match;
01709         int                  rc;
01710         ksock_proto_t       *proto;
01711         lnet_process_id_t    recv_id;
01712 
01713         /* socket type set on active connections - not set on passive */
01714         LASSERT(!active == !(conn->ksnc_type != SOCKLND_CONN_NONE));
01715 
01716         timeout = active ? *ksocknal_tunables.ksnd_timeout :
01717                             lnet_acceptor_timeout();
01718 
01719         rc = lnet_sock_read(sock, &hello->kshm_magic,
01720                             sizeof(hello->kshm_magic), timeout);
01721         if (rc != 0) {
01722                 CERROR("Error %d reading HELLO from %pI4h\n",
01723                        rc, &conn->ksnc_ipaddr);
01724                 LASSERT (rc < 0);
01725                 return rc;
01726         }
01727 
01728         if (hello->kshm_magic != LNET_PROTO_MAGIC &&
01729             hello->kshm_magic != __swab32(LNET_PROTO_MAGIC) &&
01730             hello->kshm_magic != le32_to_cpu (LNET_PROTO_TCP_MAGIC)) {
01731                 /* Unexpected magic! */
01732                 CERROR ("Bad magic(1) %#08x (%#08x expected) from "
01733                         "%pI4h\n", __cpu_to_le32 (hello->kshm_magic),
01734                         LNET_PROTO_TCP_MAGIC, &conn->ksnc_ipaddr);
01735                 return -EPROTO;
01736         }
01737 
01738         rc = lnet_sock_read(sock, &hello->kshm_version,
01739                             sizeof(hello->kshm_version), timeout);
01740         if (rc != 0) {
01741                 CERROR("Error %d reading HELLO from %pI4h\n",
01742                        rc, &conn->ksnc_ipaddr);
01743                 LASSERT(rc < 0);
01744                 return rc;
01745         }
01746 
01747         proto = ksocknal_parse_proto_version(hello);
01748         if (proto == NULL) {
01749                 if (!active) {
01750                         /* unknown protocol from peer, tell peer my protocol */
01751                         conn->ksnc_proto = &ksocknal_protocol_v3x;
01752 #if SOCKNAL_VERSION_DEBUG
01753                         if (*ksocknal_tunables.ksnd_protocol == 2)
01754                                 conn->ksnc_proto = &ksocknal_protocol_v2x;
01755                         else if (*ksocknal_tunables.ksnd_protocol == 1)
01756                                 conn->ksnc_proto = &ksocknal_protocol_v1x;
01757 #endif
01758                         hello->kshm_nips = 0;
01759                         ksocknal_send_hello(ni, conn, ni->ni_nid, hello);
01760                 }
01761 
01762                 CERROR("Unknown protocol version (%d.x expected) from %pI4h\n",
01763                        conn->ksnc_proto->pro_version, &conn->ksnc_ipaddr);
01764 
01765                 return -EPROTO;
01766         }
01767 
01768         proto_match = (conn->ksnc_proto == proto);
01769         conn->ksnc_proto = proto;
01770 
01771         /* receive the rest of hello message anyway */
01772         rc = conn->ksnc_proto->pro_recv_hello(conn, hello, timeout);
01773         if (rc != 0) {
01774                 CERROR("Error %d reading or checking hello from from %pI4h\n",
01775                        rc, &conn->ksnc_ipaddr);
01776                 LASSERT (rc < 0);
01777                 return rc;
01778         }
01779 
01780         *incarnation = hello->kshm_src_incarnation;
01781 
01782         if (hello->kshm_src_nid == LNET_NID_ANY) {
01783                 CERROR("Expecting a HELLO hdr with a NID, but got LNET_NID_ANY"
01784                        "from %pI4h\n", &conn->ksnc_ipaddr);
01785                 return -EPROTO;
01786         }
01787 
01788         if (!active &&
01789             conn->ksnc_port > LNET_ACCEPTOR_MAX_RESERVED_PORT) {
01790                 /* Userspace NAL assigns peer process ID from socket */
01791                 recv_id.pid = conn->ksnc_port | LNET_PID_USERFLAG;
01792                 recv_id.nid = LNET_MKNID(LNET_NIDNET(ni->ni_nid), conn->ksnc_ipaddr);
01793         } else {
01794                 recv_id.nid = hello->kshm_src_nid;
01795                 recv_id.pid = hello->kshm_src_pid;
01796         }
01797 
01798         if (!active) {
01799                 *peerid = recv_id;
01800 
01801                 /* peer determines type */
01802                 conn->ksnc_type = ksocknal_invert_type(hello->kshm_ctype);
01803                 if (conn->ksnc_type == SOCKLND_CONN_NONE) {
01804                         CERROR("Unexpected type %d from %s ip %pI4h\n",
01805                                hello->kshm_ctype, libcfs_id2str(*peerid),
01806                                &conn->ksnc_ipaddr);
01807                         return -EPROTO;
01808                 }
01809                 return 0;
01810         }
01811 
01812         if (peerid->pid != recv_id.pid ||
01813             peerid->nid != recv_id.nid) {
01814                 LCONSOLE_ERROR_MSG(0x130, "Connected successfully to %s on host"
01815                                    " %pI4h, but they claimed they were "
01816                                    "%s; please check your Lustre "
01817                                    "configuration.\n",
01818                                    libcfs_id2str(*peerid),
01819                                    &conn->ksnc_ipaddr,
01820                                    libcfs_id2str(recv_id));
01821                 return -EPROTO;
01822         }
01823 
01824         if (hello->kshm_ctype == SOCKLND_CONN_NONE) {
01825                 /* Possible protocol mismatch or I lost the connection race */
01826                 return proto_match ? EALREADY : EPROTO;
01827         }
01828 
01829         if (ksocknal_invert_type(hello->kshm_ctype) != conn->ksnc_type) {
01830                 CERROR("Mismatched types: me %d, %s ip %pI4h %d\n",
01831                        conn->ksnc_type, libcfs_id2str(*peerid),
01832                        &conn->ksnc_ipaddr,
01833                        hello->kshm_ctype);
01834                 return -EPROTO;
01835         }
01836         return 0;
01837 }
01838 
01839 static int
01840 ksocknal_connect (ksock_route_t *route)
01841 {
01842         struct list_head        zombies = LIST_HEAD_INIT(zombies);
01843         ksock_peer_t     *peer = route->ksnr_peer;
01844         int               type;
01845         int               wanted;
01846         struct socket     *sock;
01847         cfs_time_t        deadline;
01848         int               retry_later = 0;
01849         int               rc = 0;
01850 
01851         deadline = cfs_time_add(cfs_time_current(),
01852                                 cfs_time_seconds(*ksocknal_tunables.ksnd_timeout));
01853 
01854         write_lock_bh(&ksocknal_data.ksnd_global_lock);
01855 
01856         LASSERT (route->ksnr_scheduled);
01857         LASSERT (!route->ksnr_connecting);
01858 
01859         route->ksnr_connecting = 1;
01860 
01861         for (;;) {
01862                 wanted = ksocknal_route_mask() & ~route->ksnr_connected;
01863 
01864                 /* stop connecting if peer/route got closed under me, or
01865                  * route got connected while queued */
01866                 if (peer->ksnp_closing || route->ksnr_deleted ||
01867                     wanted == 0) {
01868                         retry_later = 0;
01869                         break;
01870                 }
01871 
01872                 /* reschedule if peer is connecting to me */
01873                 if (peer->ksnp_accepting > 0) {
01874                         CDEBUG(D_NET,
01875                                "peer %s(%d) already connecting to me, retry later.\n",
01876                                libcfs_nid2str(peer->ksnp_id.nid), peer->ksnp_accepting);
01877                         retry_later = 1;
01878                 }
01879 
01880                 if (retry_later) /* needs reschedule */
01881                         break;
01882 
01883                 if ((wanted & (1 << SOCKLND_CONN_ANY)) != 0) {
01884                         type = SOCKLND_CONN_ANY;
01885                 } else if ((wanted & (1 << SOCKLND_CONN_CONTROL)) != 0) {
01886                         type = SOCKLND_CONN_CONTROL;
01887                 } else if ((wanted & (1 << SOCKLND_CONN_BULK_IN)) != 0) {
01888                         type = SOCKLND_CONN_BULK_IN;
01889                 } else {
01890                         LASSERT ((wanted & (1 << SOCKLND_CONN_BULK_OUT)) != 0);
01891                         type = SOCKLND_CONN_BULK_OUT;
01892                 }
01893 
01894                 write_unlock_bh(&ksocknal_data.ksnd_global_lock);
01895 
01896                 if (cfs_time_aftereq(cfs_time_current(), deadline)) {
01897                         rc = -ETIMEDOUT;
01898                         lnet_connect_console_error(rc, peer->ksnp_id.nid,
01899                                                    route->ksnr_ipaddr,
01900                                                    route->ksnr_port);
01901                         goto failed;
01902                 }
01903 
01904                 rc = lnet_connect(&sock, peer->ksnp_id.nid,
01905                                   route->ksnr_myipaddr,
01906                                   route->ksnr_ipaddr, route->ksnr_port);
01907                 if (rc != 0)
01908                         goto failed;
01909 
01910                 rc = ksocknal_create_conn(peer->ksnp_ni, route, sock, type);
01911                 if (rc < 0) {
01912                         lnet_connect_console_error(rc, peer->ksnp_id.nid,
01913                                                    route->ksnr_ipaddr,
01914                                                    route->ksnr_port);
01915                         goto failed;
01916                 }
01917 
01918                 /* A +ve RC means I have to retry because I lost the connection
01919                  * race or I have to renegotiate protocol version */
01920                 retry_later = (rc != 0);
01921                 if (retry_later)
01922                         CDEBUG(D_NET, "peer %s: conn race, retry later.\n",
01923                                libcfs_nid2str(peer->ksnp_id.nid));
01924 
01925                 write_lock_bh(&ksocknal_data.ksnd_global_lock);
01926         }
01927
