01928         route->ksnr_scheduled = 0;
01929         route->ksnr_connecting = 0;
01930 
01931         if (retry_later) {
01932                 /* re-queue for attention; this frees me up to handle
01933                  * the peer's incoming connection request */
01934 
01935                 if (rc == EALREADY ||
01936                     (rc == 0 && peer->ksnp_accepting > 0)) {
01937                         /* We want to introduce a delay before next
01938                          * attempt to connect if we lost conn race,
01939                          * but the race is resolved quickly usually,
01940                          * so min_reconnectms should be good heuristic */
01941                         route->ksnr_retry_interval =
01942                                 cfs_time_seconds(*ksocknal_tunables.ksnd_min_reconnectms)/1000;
01943                         route->ksnr_timeout = cfs_time_add(cfs_time_current(),
01944                                                            route->ksnr_retry_interval);
01945                 }
01946 
01947                 ksocknal_launch_connection_locked(route);
01948         }
01949 
01950         write_unlock_bh(&ksocknal_data.ksnd_global_lock);
01951         return retry_later;
01952 
01953  failed:
01954         write_lock_bh(&ksocknal_data.ksnd_global_lock);
01955 
01956         route->ksnr_scheduled = 0;
01957         route->ksnr_connecting = 0;
01958 
01959         /* This is a retry rather than a new connection */
01960         route->ksnr_retry_interval *= 2;
01961         route->ksnr_retry_interval =
01962                 MAX(route->ksnr_retry_interval,
01963                     cfs_time_seconds(*ksocknal_tunables.ksnd_min_reconnectms)/1000);
01964         route->ksnr_retry_interval =
01965                 MIN(route->ksnr_retry_interval,
01966                     cfs_time_seconds(*ksocknal_tunables.ksnd_max_reconnectms)/1000);
01967 
01968         LASSERT (route->ksnr_retry_interval != 0);
01969         route->ksnr_timeout = cfs_time_add(cfs_time_current(),
01970                                            route->ksnr_retry_interval);
01971 
01972         if (!list_empty(&peer->ksnp_tx_queue) &&
01973             peer->ksnp_accepting == 0 &&
01974             ksocknal_find_connecting_route_locked(peer) == NULL) {
01975                 ksock_conn_t *conn;
01976 
01977                 /* ksnp_tx_queue is queued on a conn on successful
01978                  * connection for V1.x and V2.x */
01979                 if (!list_empty(&peer->ksnp_conns)) {
01980                         conn = list_entry(peer->ksnp_conns.next,
01981                                               ksock_conn_t, ksnc_list);
01982                         LASSERT (conn->ksnc_proto == &ksocknal_protocol_v3x);
01983                 }
01984 
01985                 /* take all the blocked packets while I've got the lock and
01986                  * complete below... */
01987                 list_splice_init(&peer->ksnp_tx_queue, &zombies);
01988         }
01989 
01990 #if 0           /* irrelevent with only eager routes */
01991         if (!route->ksnr_deleted) {
01992                 /* make this route least-favourite for re-selection */
01993                 list_del(&route->ksnr_list);
01994                 list_add_tail(&route->ksnr_list, &peer->ksnp_routes);
01995         }
01996 #endif
01997         write_unlock_bh(&ksocknal_data.ksnd_global_lock);
01998 
01999         ksocknal_peer_failed(peer);
02000         ksocknal_txlist_done(peer->ksnp_ni, &zombies, 1);
02001         return 0;
02002 }
02003 
02004 /*
02005  * check whether we need to create more connds.
02006  * It will try to create new thread if it's necessary, @timeout can
02007  * be updated if failed to create, so caller wouldn't keep try while
02008  * running out of resource.
02009  */
02010 static int
02011 ksocknal_connd_check_start(long sec, long *timeout)
02012 {
02013         char name[16];
02014         int rc;
02015         int total = ksocknal_data.ksnd_connd_starting +
02016                     ksocknal_data.ksnd_connd_running;
02017 
02018         if (unlikely(ksocknal_data.ksnd_init < SOCKNAL_INIT_ALL)) {
02019                 /* still in initializing */
02020                 return 0;
02021         }
02022 
02023         if (total >= *ksocknal_tunables.ksnd_nconnds_max ||
02024             total > ksocknal_data.ksnd_connd_connecting + SOCKNAL_CONND_RESV) {
02025                 /* can't create more connd, or still have enough
02026                  * threads to handle more connecting */
02027                 return 0;
02028         }
02029 
02030         if (list_empty(&ksocknal_data.ksnd_connd_routes)) {
02031                 /* no pending connecting request */
02032                 return 0;
02033         }
02034 
02035         if (sec - ksocknal_data.ksnd_connd_failed_stamp <= 1) {
02036                 /* may run out of resource, retry later */
02037                 *timeout = cfs_time_seconds(1);
02038                 return 0;
02039         }
02040 
02041         if (ksocknal_data.ksnd_connd_starting > 0) {
02042                 /* serialize starting to avoid flood */
02043                 return 0;
02044         }
02045 
02046         ksocknal_data.ksnd_connd_starting_stamp = sec;
02047         ksocknal_data.ksnd_connd_starting++;
02048         spin_unlock_bh(&ksocknal_data.ksnd_connd_lock);
02049 
02050         /* NB: total is the next id */
02051         snprintf(name, sizeof(name), "socknal_cd%02d", total);
02052         rc = ksocknal_thread_start(ksocknal_connd, NULL, name);
02053 
02054         spin_lock_bh(&ksocknal_data.ksnd_connd_lock);
02055         if (rc == 0)
02056                 return 1;
02057 
02058         /* we tried ... */
02059         LASSERT(ksocknal_data.ksnd_connd_starting > 0);
02060         ksocknal_data.ksnd_connd_starting--;
02061         ksocknal_data.ksnd_connd_failed_stamp = cfs_time_current_sec();
02062 
02063         return 1;
02064 }
02065 
02066 /*
02067  * check whether current thread can exit, it will return 1 if there are too
02068  * many threads and no creating in past 120 seconds.
02069  * Also, this function may update @timeout to make caller come back
02070  * again to recheck these conditions.
02071  */
02072 static int
02073 ksocknal_connd_check_stop(long sec, long *timeout)
02074 {
02075         int val;
02076 
02077         if (unlikely(ksocknal_data.ksnd_init < SOCKNAL_INIT_ALL)) {
02078                 /* still in initializing */
02079                 return 0;
02080         }
02081 
02082         if (ksocknal_data.ksnd_connd_starting > 0) {
02083                 /* in progress of starting new thread */
02084                 return 0;
02085         }
02086 
02087         if (ksocknal_data.ksnd_connd_running <=
02088             *ksocknal_tunables.ksnd_nconnds) { /* can't shrink */
02089                 return 0;
02090         }
02091 
02092         /* created thread in past 120 seconds? */
02093         val = (int)(ksocknal_data.ksnd_connd_starting_stamp +
02094                     SOCKNAL_CONND_TIMEOUT - sec);
02095 
02096         *timeout = (val > 0) ? cfs_time_seconds(val) :
02097                                cfs_time_seconds(SOCKNAL_CONND_TIMEOUT);
02098         if (val > 0)
02099                 return 0;
02100 
02101         /* no creating in past 120 seconds */
02102 
02103         return ksocknal_data.ksnd_connd_running >
02104                ksocknal_data.ksnd_connd_connecting + SOCKNAL_CONND_RESV;
02105 }
02106 
02107 /* Go through connd_routes queue looking for a route that we can process
02108  * right now, @timeout_p can be updated if we need to come back later */
02109 static ksock_route_t *
02110 ksocknal_connd_get_route_locked(signed long *timeout_p)
02111 {
02112         ksock_route_t *route;
02113         cfs_time_t     now;
02114 
02115         now = cfs_time_current();
02116 
02117         /* connd_routes can contain both pending and ordinary routes */
02118         list_for_each_entry(route, &ksocknal_data.ksnd_connd_routes,
02119                                  ksnr_connd_list) {
02120 
02121                 if (route->ksnr_retry_interval == 0 ||
02122                     cfs_time_aftereq(now, route->ksnr_timeout))
02123                         return route;
02124 
02125                 if (*timeout_p == MAX_SCHEDULE_TIMEOUT ||
02126                     (int)*timeout_p > (int)(route->ksnr_timeout - now))
02127                         *timeout_p = (int)(route->ksnr_timeout - now);
02128         }
02129 
02130         return NULL;
02131 }
02132 
02133 int
02134 ksocknal_connd (void *arg)
02135 {
02136         spinlock_t    *connd_lock = &ksocknal_data.ksnd_connd_lock;
02137         ksock_connreq_t   *cr;
02138         wait_queue_t     wait;
02139         int                nloops = 0;
02140         int                cons_retry = 0;
02141 
02142         cfs_block_allsigs();
02143 
02144         init_waitqueue_entry(&wait, current);
02145 
02146         spin_lock_bh(connd_lock);
02147 
02148         LASSERT(ksocknal_data.ksnd_connd_starting > 0);
02149         ksocknal_data.ksnd_connd_starting--;
02150         ksocknal_data.ksnd_connd_running++;
02151 
02152         while (!ksocknal_data.ksnd_shuttingdown) {
02153                 ksock_route_t *route = NULL;
02154                 long sec = cfs_time_current_sec();
02155                 long timeout = MAX_SCHEDULE_TIMEOUT;
02156                 int  dropped_lock = 0;
02157 
02158                 if (ksocknal_connd_check_stop(sec, &timeout)) {
02159                         /* wakeup another one to check stop */
02160                         wake_up(&ksocknal_data.ksnd_connd_waitq);
02161                         break;
02162                 }
02163 
02164                 if (ksocknal_connd_check_start(sec, &timeout)) {
02165                         /* created new thread */
02166                         dropped_lock = 1;
02167                 }
02168 
02169                 if (!list_empty(&ksocknal_data.ksnd_connd_connreqs)) {
02170                         /* Connection accepted by the listener */
02171                         cr = list_entry(ksocknal_data.ksnd_connd_connreqs. \
02172                                             next, ksock_connreq_t, ksncr_list);
02173 
02174                         list_del(&cr->ksncr_list);
02175                         spin_unlock_bh(connd_lock);
02176                         dropped_lock = 1;
02177 
02178                         ksocknal_create_conn(cr->ksncr_ni, NULL,
02179                                              cr->ksncr_sock, SOCKLND_CONN_NONE);
02180                         lnet_ni_decref(cr->ksncr_ni);
02181                         LIBCFS_FREE(cr, sizeof(*cr));
02182 
02183                         spin_lock_bh(connd_lock);
02184                 }
02185 
02186                 /* Only handle an outgoing connection request if there
02187                  * is a thread left to handle incoming connections and
02188                  * create new connd */
02189                 if (ksocknal_data.ksnd_connd_connecting + SOCKNAL_CONND_RESV <
02190                     ksocknal_data.ksnd_connd_running) {
02191                         route = ksocknal_connd_get_route_locked(&timeout);
02192                 }
02193                 if (route != NULL) {
02194                         list_del(&route->ksnr_connd_list);
02195                         ksocknal_data.ksnd_connd_connecting++;
02196                         spin_unlock_bh(connd_lock);
02197                         dropped_lock = 1;
02198 
02199                         if (ksocknal_connect(route)) {
02200                                 /* consecutive retry */
02201                                 if (cons_retry++ > SOCKNAL_INSANITY_RECONN) {
02202                                         CWARN("massive consecutive "
02203                                               "re-connecting to %pI4h\n",
02204                                               &route->ksnr_ipaddr);
02205                                         cons_retry = 0;
02206                                 }
02207                         } else {
02208                                 cons_retry = 0;
02209                         }
02210 
02211                         ksocknal_route_decref(route);
02212 
02213                         spin_lock_bh(connd_lock);
02214                         ksocknal_data.ksnd_connd_connecting--;
02215                 }
02216 
02217                 if (dropped_lock) {
02218                         if (++nloops < SOCKNAL_RESCHED)
02219                                 continue;
02220                         spin_unlock_bh(connd_lock);
02221                         nloops = 0;
02222                         cond_resched();
02223                         spin_lock_bh(connd_lock);
02224                         continue;
02225                 }
02226 
02227                 /* Nothing to do for 'timeout'  */
02228                 set_current_state(TASK_INTERRUPTIBLE);
02229                 add_wait_queue_exclusive(&ksocknal_data.ksnd_connd_waitq, &wait);
02230                 spin_unlock_bh(connd_lock);
02231 
02232                 nloops = 0;
02233                 schedule_timeout(timeout);
02234 
02235                 set_current_state(TASK_RUNNING);
02236                 remove_wait_queue(&ksocknal_data.ksnd_connd_waitq, &wait);
02237                 spin_lock_bh(connd_lock);
02238         }
02239         ksocknal_data.ksnd_connd_running--;
02240         spin_unlock_bh(connd_lock);
02241 
02242         ksocknal_thread_fini();
02243         return 0;
02244 }
02245 
02246 static ksock_conn_t *
02247 ksocknal_find_timed_out_conn (ksock_peer_t *peer)
02248 {
02249         /* We're called with a shared lock on ksnd_global_lock */
02250         ksock_conn_t      *conn;
02251         struct list_head        *ctmp;
02252 
02253         list_for_each(ctmp, &peer->ksnp_conns) {
02254                 int     error;
02255                 conn = list_entry(ctmp, ksock_conn_t, ksnc_list);
02256 
02257                 /* Don't need the {get,put}connsock dance to deref ksnc_sock */
02258                 LASSERT (!conn->ksnc_closing);
02259 
02260                 error = conn->ksnc_sock->sk->sk_err;
02261                 if (error != 0) {
02262                         ksocknal_conn_addref(conn);
02263 
02264                         switch (error) {
02265                         case ECONNRESET:
02266                                 CNETERR("A connection with %s "
02267                                         "(%pI4h:%d) was reset; "
02268                                         "it may have rebooted.\n",
02269                                         libcfs_id2str(peer->ksnp_id),
02270                                         &conn->ksnc_ipaddr,
02271                                         conn->ksnc_port);
02272                                 break;
02273                         case ETIMEDOUT:
02274                                 CNETERR("A connection with %s "
02275                                         "(%pI4h:%d) timed out; the "
02276                                         "network or node may be down.\n",
02277                                         libcfs_id2str(peer->ksnp_id),
02278                                         &conn->ksnc_ipaddr,
02279                                         conn->ksnc_port);
02280                                 break;
02281                         default:
02282                                 CNETERR("An unexpected network error %d "
02283                                         "occurred with %s "
02284                                         "(%pI4h:%d\n", error,
02285                                         libcfs_id2str(peer->ksnp_id),
02286                                         &conn->ksnc_ipaddr,
02287                                         conn->ksnc_port);
02288                                 break;
02289                         }
02290 
02291                         return (conn);
02292                 }
02293 
02294                 if (conn->ksnc_rx_started &&
02295                     cfs_time_aftereq(cfs_time_current(),
02296                                      conn->ksnc_rx_deadline)) {
02297                         /* Timed out incomplete incoming message */
02298                         ksocknal_conn_addref(conn);
02299                         CNETERR("Timeout receiving from %s (%pI4h:%d), "
02300                                 "state %d wanted %d left %d\n",
02301                                 libcfs_id2str(peer->ksnp_id),
02302                                 &conn->ksnc_ipaddr,
02303                                 conn->ksnc_port,
02304                                 conn->ksnc_rx_state,
02305                                 conn->ksnc_rx_nob_wanted,
02306                                 conn->ksnc_rx_nob_left);
02307                         return (conn);
02308                 }
02309 
02310                 if ((!list_empty(&conn->ksnc_tx_queue) ||
02311                      conn->ksnc_sock->sk->sk_wmem_queued != 0) &&
02312                     cfs_time_aftereq(cfs_time_current(),
02313                                      conn->ksnc_tx_deadline)) {
02314                         /* Timed out messages queued for sending or
02315                          * buffered in the socket's send buffer */
02316                         ksocknal_conn_addref(conn);
02317                         CNETERR("Timeout sending data to %s (%pI4h:%d) "
02318                                 "the network or that node may be down.\n",
02319                                 libcfs_id2str(peer->ksnp_id),
02320                                 &conn->ksnc_ipaddr, conn->ksnc_port);
02321                         return (conn);
02322                 }
02323         }
02324 
02325         return (NULL);
02326 }
02327 
02328 static inline void
02329 ksocknal_flush_stale_txs(ksock_peer_t *peer)
02330 {
02331         ksock_tx_t        *tx;
02332         struct list_head        stale_txs = LIST_HEAD_INIT(stale_txs);
02333 
02334         write_lock_bh(&ksocknal_data.ksnd_global_lock);
02335 
02336         while (!list_empty(&peer->ksnp_tx_queue)) {
02337                 tx = list_entry(peer->ksnp_tx_queue.next,
02338                                      ksock_tx_t, tx_list);
02339 
02340                 if (!cfs_time_aftereq(cfs_time_current(),
02341                                       tx->tx_deadline))
02342                         break;
02343 
02344                 list_del(&tx->tx_list);
02345                 list_add_tail(&tx->tx_list, &stale_txs);
02346         }
02347 
02348         write_unlock_bh(&ksocknal_data.ksnd_global_lock);
02349 
02350         ksocknal_txlist_done(peer->ksnp_ni, &stale_txs, 1);
02351 }
02352 
02353 static int
02354 ksocknal_send_keepalive_locked(ksock_peer_t *peer)
02355 __must_hold(&ksocknal_data.ksnd_global_lock)
02356 {
02357         ksock_sched_t  *sched;
02358         ksock_conn_t   *conn;
02359         ksock_tx_t     *tx;
02360 
02361         /* last_alive will be updated by create_conn */
02362         if (list_empty(&peer->ksnp_conns))
02363                 return 0;
02364 
02365         if (peer->ksnp_proto != &ksocknal_protocol_v3x)
02366                 return 0;
02367 
02368         if (*ksocknal_tunables.ksnd_keepalive <= 0 ||
02369             cfs_time_before(cfs_time_current(),
02370                             cfs_time_add(peer->ksnp_last_alive,
02371                                          cfs_time_seconds(*ksocknal_tunables.ksnd_keepalive))))
02372                 return 0;
02373 
02374         if (cfs_time_before(cfs_time_current(),
02375                             peer->ksnp_send_keepalive))
02376                 return 0;
02377 
02378         /* retry 10 secs later, so we wouldn't put pressure
02379          * on this peer if we failed to send keepalive this time */
02380         peer->ksnp_send_keepalive = cfs_time_shift(10);
02381 
02382         conn = ksocknal_find_conn_locked(peer, NULL, 1);
02383         if (conn != NULL) {
02384                 sched = conn->ksnc_scheduler;
02385 
02386                 spin_lock_bh(&sched->kss_lock);
02387                 if (!list_empty(&conn->ksnc_tx_queue)) {
02388                         spin_unlock_bh(&sched->kss_lock);
02389                         /* there is an queued ACK, don't need keepalive */
02390                         return 0;
02391                 }
02392 
02393                 spin_unlock_bh(&sched->kss_lock);
02394         }
02395 
02396         read_unlock(&ksocknal_data.ksnd_global_lock);
02397 
02398         /* cookie = 1 is reserved for keepalive PING */
02399         tx = ksocknal_alloc_tx_noop(1, 1);
02400         if (tx == NULL) {
02401                 read_lock(&ksocknal_data.ksnd_global_lock);
02402                 return -ENOMEM;
02403         }
02404 
02405         if (ksocknal_launch_packet(peer->ksnp_ni, tx, peer->ksnp_id) == 0) {
02406                 read_lock(&ksocknal_data.ksnd_global_lock);
02407                 return 1;
02408         }
02409 
02410         ksocknal_free_tx(tx);
02411         read_lock(&ksocknal_data.ksnd_global_lock);
02412 
02413         return -EIO;
02414 }
02415 
02416 
02417 static void
02418 ksocknal_check_peer_timeouts (int idx)
02419 {
02420         struct list_head       *peers = &ksocknal_data.ksnd_peers[idx];
02421         ksock_peer_t     *peer;
02422         ksock_conn_t     *conn;
02423         ksock_tx_t       *tx;
02424 
02425  again:
02426         /* NB. We expect to have a look at all the peers and not find any
02427          * connections to time out, so we just use a shared lock while we
02428          * take a look... */
02429         read_lock(&ksocknal_data.ksnd_global_lock);
02430 
02431         list_for_each_entry(peer, peers, ksnp_list) {
02432                 cfs_time_t  deadline = 0;
02433                 int         resid = 0;
02434                 int         n     = 0;
02435 
02436                 if (ksocknal_send_keepalive_locked(peer) != 0) {
02437                         read_unlock(&ksocknal_data.ksnd_global_lock);
02438                         goto again;
02439                 }
02440 
02441                 conn = ksocknal_find_timed_out_conn (peer);
02442 
02443                 if (conn != NULL) {
02444                         read_unlock(&ksocknal_data.ksnd_global_lock);
02445 
02446                         ksocknal_close_conn_and_siblings (conn, -ETIMEDOUT);
02447 
02448                         /* NB we won't find this one again, but we can't
02449                          * just proceed with the next peer, since we dropped
02450                          * ksnd_global_lock and it might be dead already! */
02451                         ksocknal_conn_decref(conn);
02452                         goto again;
02453                 }
02454 
02455                 /* we can't process stale txs right here because we're
02456                  * holding only shared lock */
02457                 if (!list_empty(&peer->ksnp_tx_queue)) {
02458                         ksock_tx_t *tx =
02459                                 list_entry(peer->ksnp_tx_queue.next,
02460                                                 ksock_tx_t, tx_list);
02461 
02462                         if (cfs_time_aftereq(cfs_time_current(),
02463                                              tx->tx_deadline)) {
02464 
02465                                 ksocknal_peer_addref(peer);
02466                                 read_unlock(&ksocknal_data.ksnd_global_lock);
02467 
02468                                 ksocknal_flush_stale_txs(peer);
02469 
02470                                 ksocknal_peer_decref(peer);
02471                                 goto again;
02472                         }
02473                 }
02474 
02475                 if (list_empty(&peer->ksnp_zc_req_list))
02476                         continue;
02477 
02478                 spin_lock(&peer->ksnp_lock);
02479                 list_for_each_entry(tx, &peer->ksnp_zc_req_list, tx_zc_list) {
02480                         if (!cfs_time_aftereq(cfs_time_current(),
02481                                               tx->tx_deadline))
02482                                 break;
02483                         /* ignore the TX if connection is being closed */
02484                         if (tx->tx_conn->ksnc_closing)
02485                                 continue;
02486                         n++;
02487                 }
02488 
02489                 if (n == 0) {
02490                         spin_unlock(&peer->ksnp_lock);
02491                         continue;
02492                 }
02493 
02494                 tx = list_entry(peer->ksnp_zc_req_list.next,
02495                                     ksock_tx_t, tx_zc_list);
02496                 deadline = tx->tx_deadline;
02497                 resid    = tx->tx_resid;
02498                 conn     = tx->tx_conn;
02499                 ksocknal_conn_addref(conn);
02500 
02501                 spin_unlock(&peer->ksnp_lock);
02502                 read_unlock(&ksocknal_data.ksnd_global_lock);
02503 
02504                 CERROR("Total %d stale ZC_REQs for peer %s detected; the "
02505                        "oldest(%p) timed out %ld secs ago, "
02506                        "resid: %d, wmem: %d\n",
02507                        n, libcfs_nid2str(peer->ksnp_id.nid), tx,
02508                        cfs_duration_sec(cfs_time_current() - deadline),
02509                        resid, conn->ksnc_sock->sk->sk_wmem_queued);
02510 
02511                 ksocknal_close_conn_and_siblings (conn, -ETIMEDOUT);
02512                 ksocknal_conn_decref(conn);
02513                 goto again;
02514         }
02515 
02516         read_unlock(&ksocknal_data.ksnd_global_lock);
02517 }
02518 
02519 int ksocknal_reaper(void *arg)
02520 {
02521         wait_queue_t     wait;
02522         ksock_conn_t      *conn;
02523         ksock_sched_t     *sched;
02524         struct list_head         enomem_conns;
02525         int                nenomem_conns;
02526         cfs_duration_t     timeout;
02527         int                i;
02528         int                peer_index = 0;
02529         cfs_time_t         deadline = cfs_time_current();
02530 
02531         cfs_block_allsigs ();
02532 
02533         INIT_LIST_HEAD(&enomem_conns);
02534         init_waitqueue_entry(&wait, current);
02535 
02536         spin_lock_bh(&ksocknal_data.ksnd_reaper_lock);
02537 
02538         while (!ksocknal_data.ksnd_shuttingdown) {
02539 
02540                 if (!list_empty(&ksocknal_data.ksnd_deathrow_conns)) {
02541                         conn = list_entry(ksocknal_data. \
02542                                                ksnd_deathrow_conns.next,
02543                                                ksock_conn_t, ksnc_list);
02544                         list_del(&conn->ksnc_list);
02545 
02546                         spin_unlock_bh(&ksocknal_data.ksnd_reaper_lock);
02547 
02548                         ksocknal_terminate_conn(conn);
02549                         ksocknal_conn_decref(conn);
02550 
02551                         spin_lock_bh(&ksocknal_data.ksnd_reaper_lock);
02552                         continue;
02553                 }
02554 
02555                 if (!list_empty(&ksocknal_data.ksnd_zombie_conns)) {
02556                         conn = list_entry(ksocknal_data.ksnd_zombie_conns.\
02557                                                next, ksock_conn_t, ksnc_list);
02558                         list_del(&conn->ksnc_list);
02559 
02560                         spin_unlock_bh(&ksocknal_data.ksnd_reaper_lock);
02561 
02562                         ksocknal_destroy_conn(conn);
02563 
02564                         spin_lock_bh(&ksocknal_data.ksnd_reaper_lock);
02565                         continue;
02566                 }
02567 
02568                 if (!list_empty(&ksocknal_data.ksnd_enomem_conns)) {
02569                         list_add(&enomem_conns,
02570                                      &ksocknal_data.ksnd_enomem_conns);
02571                         list_del_init(&ksocknal_data.ksnd_enomem_conns);
02572                 }
02573 
02574                 spin_unlock_bh(&ksocknal_data.ksnd_reaper_lock);
02575 
02576                 /* reschedule all the connections that stalled with ENOMEM... */
02577                 nenomem_conns = 0;
02578                 while (!list_empty(&enomem_conns)) {
02579                         conn = list_entry(enomem_conns.next,
02580                                                ksock_conn_t, ksnc_tx_list);
02581                         list_del(&conn->ksnc_tx_list);
02582 
02583                         sched = conn->ksnc_scheduler;
02584 
02585                         spin_lock_bh(&sched->kss_lock);
02586 
02587                         LASSERT(conn->ksnc_tx_scheduled);
02588                         conn->ksnc_tx_ready = 1;
02589                         list_add_tail(&conn->ksnc_tx_list,
02590                                           &sched->kss_tx_conns);
02591                         wake_up(&sched->kss_waitq);
02592 
02593                         spin_unlock_bh(&sched->kss_lock);
02594                         nenomem_conns++;
02595                 }
02596 
02597                 /* careful with the jiffy wrap... */
02598                 while ((timeout = cfs_time_sub(deadline,
02599                                                cfs_time_current())) <= 0) {
02600                         const int n = 4;
02601                         const int p = 1;
02602                         int       chunk = ksocknal_data.ksnd_peer_hash_size;
02603 
02604                         /* Time to check for timeouts on a few more peers: I do
02605                          * checks every 'p' seconds on a proportion of the peer
02606                          * table and I need to check every connection 'n' times
02607                          * within a timeout interval, to ensure I detect a
02608                          * timeout on any connection within (n+1)/n times the
02609                          * timeout interval. */
02610 
02611                         if (*ksocknal_tunables.ksnd_timeout > n * p)
02612                                 chunk = (chunk * n * p) /
02613                                         *ksocknal_tunables.ksnd_timeout;
02614                         if (chunk == 0)
02615                                 chunk = 1;
02616 
02617                         for (i = 0; i < chunk; i++) {
02618                                 ksocknal_check_peer_timeouts (peer_index);
02619                                 peer_index = (peer_index + 1) %
02620                                              ksocknal_data.ksnd_peer_hash_size;
02621                         }
02622 
02623                         deadline = cfs_time_add(deadline, cfs_time_seconds(p));
02624                 }
02625 
02626                 if (nenomem_conns != 0) {
02627                         /* Reduce my timeout if I rescheduled ENOMEM conns.
02628                          * This also prevents me getting woken immediately
02629                          * if any go back on my enomem list. */
02630                         timeout = SOCKNAL_ENOMEM_RETRY;
02631                 }
02632                 ksocknal_data.ksnd_reaper_waketime =
02633                         cfs_time_add(cfs_time_current(), timeout);
02634 
02635                         set_current_state(TASK_INTERRUPTIBLE);
02636                 add_wait_queue(&ksocknal_data.ksnd_reaper_waitq, &wait);
02637 
02638                 if (!ksocknal_data.ksnd_shuttingdown &&
02639                     list_empty(&ksocknal_data.ksnd_deathrow_conns) &&
02640                     list_empty(&ksocknal_data.ksnd_zombie_conns))
02641                         schedule_timeout(timeout);
02642 
02643                 set_current_state(TASK_RUNNING);
02644                 remove_wait_queue(&ksocknal_data.ksnd_reaper_waitq, &wait);
02645 
02646                 spin_lock_bh(&ksocknal_data.ksnd_reaper_lock);
02647         }
02648 
02649         spin_unlock_bh(&ksocknal_data.ksnd_reaper_lock);
02650 
02651         ksocknal_thread_fini();
02652         return 0;
02653 }
